loans.name: Yasoni

texts.en:
Yasoni is 43 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years Yasoni has been working hard to manage his charcoal sales business.

To help expand his business Yasoni has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal and will help him to generate greater profits and clientele. Yasoni hopes that in the future he will be able to distribute charcoal to individual shops.

Yasoni is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 30 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, eggs, sugar, water, and snacks, and will help Agnes to generate and increase profits. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business.

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, eggs, sugar, water, and snacks.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Veuve,  Aminatou  a en charge ses cinq enfants. Elle habite à Tokoin et fait le commerce des produits d’hygiène pour femme, enfants et bébés.  Aminatou  s’approvisionne une fois par mois et vend dans le quartier. Aminatou désire ce crédit pour commander des couches bébé, des moustiquaires. Ce crédit l’aidera à acquérir une plus grande quantité et avoir plus de revenu afin de financer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aminatou is a widow with five dependent children. She lives in Tokoin and trades in hygiene products for women, children, and babies.

Aminatou procures her supplies once a month and retails locally. She wants this loan to order diapers and mosquito nets.

This loan will help her purchase a larger quantity of products and increase her revenues, so that she can fund her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of detergent, four boxes of diapers, two dozen mosquito nets for babies, and one box of sanitary napkins for women.

loans.name: Patricia Annabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tuvo  3 hijos pero uno falleció, los dos restantes tienen 19 y 14 años de edad, el menor estudian en colegio. El marido  se dedica a la pesca, ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Patricia tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí ella confecciona prendas de damas y niños,  ella también confecciona ropa para la venta y compra mercadería elaborada la misma que vende en su local y sale a vender por la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días ya sea cociendo las prendas o en sus ventas, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar ropa, telas, cierres, hilos, materiales para la  costura. Lleva más 14  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y muy buenos. Sus sueños son  darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Loan Group for the Support of Women meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo region. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, where the majority of its inhabitants are very hard-working and engaged in sea-related work.

Patricia lives in this place.  She is 41 years old and is married.  From this relationship she had three children, but one passed away.  The other two are 19 and 14 years old.  The younger child is in school.  Her husband makes a living as a fisherman.  Several years ago, Patricia learned sewing in a local school.  

Patricia has a small sewing workshop in her home.  There, she makes garments for women and children.  She also makes clothes to sell and buys pre-made merchandise that is the same as what she sells in her neighborhood and goes out to sell it in the city.  She works every day either sewing garments or selling them.  She has been engaged in this occupation for more than 15 years, which has helped her to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, fabrics, zippers, needles, and materials for sewing.  She has been in the Loan Group for more than 14 years and she likes it because the loans are fast and very good.  Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fabric, zippers, thread, and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Taibah School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Madina. She is the Head teacher of Taibah Junior School, a mixed school with 150 students, in the urban area of Kampala. Taibah School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students everyday. Taibah School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.

Madina ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 23 Décembre 2014 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles font aussi de la culture sous pluie. 

Madame Coumba (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 43 ans et  mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des arachides.  Elle jouit d’une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des arachides d’une valeur de 23000f et du mil d’un montant de 20000f pour le renouveler à la fin de son stock

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et d’assister ses enfants dans leurs différents besoins.
texts.en:
The group was created on December 23, 2014, when their village finance association was inaugurated. The group mostly comprises women who have gained solid experience in retail, which is also their main business. They all live in the same village, and share values of solidarity and reciprocal support. They also farm in the rainy season.

Mrs. Coumba (standing to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is married, 43 years old, and a mother of three, including two girls and one boy. Her business consists in buy and reselling groundnuts. She benefits from an excellent amount of experience in this domain.

This new loan will allow her to purchase groundnuts valued at 23,000 XOF and millet for 20,000 XOF to renew her expiring stock.

Profits will make it possible for her to help her husband with daily expenses and to provide for her children’s various needs.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for 23,000 XOF and millet for 20,000 to renew her stock when exhausted.

loans.name: Dilshodbek

texts.ru: Дилшод молодой мужчина в возрасте 26 лет. Дилшод женат и имеет 3 детей. Проживает Дилшод в сельской местности и занимается фото и видео съемкой торжественных мероприятий. Эту проффесию он выбрал не случайно, с раннего детства он увлекался фотосъемкой. Работать он начал еще в юности и за несколько лет он смог расширить свой спектр услуг и увеличить клиентуру. Так как семья у Дилшода большая и он является единственным кормильцем в семье ему приходится трудится каждый день. На данный момент Дилшод хочет купить видеокамеру но испытывает нехватку финансов. С данной проблемой он решил обратится в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Дилшод планирует купить видеокамеру. Он заранее благодарен Арванд за предоставленную помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en: Dilshod is a young, 26 year old man. He is married and has three children. He lives in a rural area and works filming and photographing special events. This is not a profession he just stumbled into; photography has been an interest of his since childhood. He began working early, and after a few years was able to expand the services he offers and attract a larger customer base. Since he has a large family and is the sole breadwinner,  he has to work every day. At the moment he wants to buy a videocamera but doesn't have the funds. He decided to contact Arvand for help with this issue. Dilshod plans to use the money received to buy a videocamera. He thanks the organization in advance for helping rural residents.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Victory Groupq

texts.en:
The group Victory is made up of four women who live with their families. They are originally from Chorkor, which is located in the greater-Accra region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible and with an eagerness for personal success. They are into cosmetics, hairdressing, wigs, fruits, seamstress and soft drinks. They work hard to get ahead as a family and in their businesses. In spite of all of the obstacles, they overcome every day thanks to their desire to succeed.

Florence is the representative and she is a hairdresser. She operates from a container shop, where she also sells cosmetics in addition to the hairdressing. The business is located in her home and because of the needs of the business, her work routine is about 12 hours a day in order to meet her customers’ demands and to buy more cosmetics, hair cream, shampoo, and wigs to serve her customers better.

Her goal is to increase her stock in the near future to obtain a better income. They will need a total amount of GHS 7,000 to be able increase their stock and improve their services.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, hair cream, shampoo, and wigs to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
It’s not impossible to for a vendor to own a decent house for her family someday. This is the principle of Gemma, 54, from Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato who prepares and sells banana cue and camote (sweet potato) cue in a stall near a city high school in their community. Banana cue is made from “saba” (a type of banana) while camote cue is sweet potato, deeply fried and coated with caramelized sugar. Two to three pieces are skewered on a bamboo stick which is usually more than enough of a serving for one person. This is appealing for students because a one-stick serving sold at a meager price fills the stomach. The increasing demand for her product led her to employ four helpers. Therefore her business not only sustains her family’s needs but also the needs of her four helpers. In this way, she is a blessing to them.

As a faithful member of the Baptist Church, she aims to continue being a blessing to others through her business. She applied for a PHP 25,000 loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, and cooking oil for her food stall business. She hopes you could help her as she strives to help others too. 

She’s married to Jesus and they are blessed with five children. The whole family works hard to fully pay for their lot located in a village and subsequently build a better house for better living conditions. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, and cooking oil for her food stall business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man with seven children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of efficient tools for the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more carpentry tools. He hopes that in the future he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more carpentry tools

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 47 años de edad está casada y de esta  relación tiene 6 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y dos niñas de 12 y 10 años las mismas que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Ana además de ser una gran madre y esposa se dedica a la comercio, ella tiene un negocio en su casa, allí vende sodas, jugos, yogurt, hielo,  helados, golosinas, etc. Ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus faenas de pesca, él tiene una lancha en la cual junto con  sus hijos se van a alta mara a pescar, ellos salen y no regresan sino hasta después de dos  días con los peces que el mar les  da, luego en la playa les  venden a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar a los pescadores de la zona, de esta forma ellos salen adelante juntos como una gran familia que son.
Este crédito es para comprar sodas, yogurt, jugos y materiales para la pesca. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener un barco grande.
texts.en:
The “Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer” [Credit Group for the Support of Women] meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo neighborhood. This place is known for its beautiful beaches where the majority of the inhabitants are hard working and work in fishing jobs in the ocean. 

Ana lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children from this relationship. 4 are adults and two are girls of 12 and 10 years old, who are in school. The husband works as a fisherman.

Ana, in addition to being a great mother and wife, works in commerce. She has a store in her home. Here, she sells sodas, juices, yogurt, ice, ice cream, sweets, etc. She also gives part of the loan to her husband to use for fishing. He has a boat in which he, along with his children, go out on the open seas to fish. They leave and do not return until two days later with all of the fish that the ocean gives them. Then, they sell them to the merchants at the beach who arrive down there to buy from the fisherman of the area. They get ahead together, in this way, like the great family that they are.

This loan is to buy sodas, yogurt, juices and materials for fishing. She has been with the credit group for 12 years and likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to have a big boat.

loans.use: to buy sodas, yogurt, juices and materials for fishing.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en: Protus is a married man with eight children. He describes himself as a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good location and his primary customers are farmers and meat suppliers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more livestock. His business goal is to have an animal ranch within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: María Concepcion

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y de esta  relación tiene 8 hijos, siete mayores y el menor de 16  años de edad, siete de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a sus hijos se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la mañana y regresan a la tarde y en ocasiones hasta el otro día con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia, de esta forma ellos salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para  comprar redes piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que salen a pescar. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y los créditos adicionales que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo y sus hijos realicen sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The "Para La Ayuda De La Mujer" (To Help Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo canton, a place known for its beautiful beaches, and where most of the inhabitants are very hard-working, and engaged in jobs related to fishing.

Maria lives here. She is 55, married, and has 8 children; 7 are adults and the youngest is 16. 7 still live in their home. Her husband is a fisherman.

María is a good housewife who is undertaking the loan so that her husband can have the resources necessary to do well in his livelihood. Her husband goes fishing. He and his children go out on the high seas in their small boat to fish. They go out in the morning and return with their catch in the afternoon. Once at the beach, they hand over their catch to wholesalers so that the latter can distribute them to the entire province. This is how they are moving forward in life.

This loan is to buy nets, rope, fuel and food for the days they go out to fish. She has been in the communal bank for 6 years and likes it because of the assistance and additional loans that the institution offers her. Her dream is to have a large boat so that her husband and children can carry on their fishing.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, fuel and food.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 58 years old, married and the father of four kids. He is from Sabirabad. Hasan is currently retired.  He is a very intelligent and steady man. He doesn’t earn enough because his pension is very low and his monthly income is 150 AZN. 

Hasan has a serious problem. One of his four children is ill. He needs a loan and Kiva lenders' support. Hasan must buy drugs and pay the hospital charge for his child.

loans.use: to buy drugs and pay the hospital charge for his child.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Yasin has been working hard to manage his hair dressing business, which operates a salon. 

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cosmetics for hair and will help Yasin to generate greater profits and generate more income. Yasin hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Yasin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yasin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy hair cosmetics for sale in his salon

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a single woman with two children. She describes herself as loving. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man with four children. He describes himself as patient. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more cows. His business goal is to have a ranch within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Almara

texts.en:
Almara is 53 years old, married and the mother of three kids. She is from Sabirabad. Almara is a merchant. She is an intelligent and diligent woman. All of the people in Sabirabad love her. 

Almara started her work about 10 years ago. She doesn’t earn enough so she is not happy. Her monthly income is 400 AZN. She wants to purchase new clothing and sell it at the local bazaar. Almara has had two loans from Agroinvest in the past and always made her payments on time. She needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing and sell it at the local bazaar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her bakery and casserole dishes for putting bread in the oven

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and banana for selling.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is aged 44 married with 6 children and only 4 attend school in Hoima Uganda. He owns a butcher shop mainly slaughtering cows and goats.

He ventured into farming in order to raise enough incomes to support his family. He has hopes of growing and expanding his business as well as educating his children. However, capital inadequacy poses a strong threat to his business. 

He will use the loan facility to buy more cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Yenis Karina

texts.es:
Yenis, de 20 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta 8° grado en la escuela de su cantón luego tuvo que dejar de estudiar porque sus padres ya no podían darle el estudio por la misma condición económica de la familia, sus dos hijos uno de 5 y el otro de dos años no estudian están pequeños, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar en una cantera que está cerca de su casa.

Yenis, se dedica a trabajar en el comercio informal, se dedica a trabajar por las tardes a vender pususas y otros antojitos para que pueda ayudar en los gastos familiares, su compañero después de regresar de trabajar le ayuda a preparar lo necesario para prepararlos alimentos, esto los hace casi todas las tardes fuera de su casa donde pasa una buena afluencia de personas.

Yenis, utilizara los fondos de este crédito para comprar una refrigeradora ya que en la zona se consume bastante el hielo para preservar el pescado fresco las vendedoras de la zona ya que es una zona que en su mayoría de los habitantes dependen del comercio de peses.

Ella tiene un sueño y es poder ampliar sus negocio ya que su compañero  y con ayuda del crédito poder aumentar su pequeño negocio y con la compra de la refrigeradora tendrá mayor cantidad de clientes y podrá tener mayores ventas y podrá ayudar con los gastos de la familia ya que sus hijos van creciendo y espera estudien y puedan alcanzar metas que ella esperaba alcanzar y por la condición económica no lo pudo hacer.
texts.en:
20-year-old Yenis was able to attend her canton's school until 8th grade. She then had to stop her studies because her parents couldn't provide her with education anymore, because of the family's economic situation. Her two children, a 5-year-old and a 2-year-old, don't go to school because they are too little. Her life partner makes a living working in a quarry near their house.

Yenis works in informal sales, selling pupusas and other snacks, so that she can help with the family expenses. After returning from work, her partner helps her prepare what is necessary to make the food. She makes the food almost every afternoon, outside her house where a good number of people pass by.

Yenis will use the funds from this loan to buy a refrigerator. In her area, the saleswomen use a lot of ice to preserve fresh fish because it is a region where the majority of the inhabitants depend on the sale of fish.

She has a dream, and it is to be able to expand her business with the help of the loan. With the purchase of the refrigerator, she will have a higher number of customers and will have more sales. She will be able to help with the family expenses. Her children are growing up, and she hopes that they will go to school and achieve goals that she had hoped for but was not able to reach, due to her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Nhor’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nhor makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a housewife and a mother of 3 children; she requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. Her husband is the main earner of the family and generates all his the income from driving the rickshaw. 

Unfortunately the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Tahimas children skipping school due to lack of resources at their mother's disposal.  She wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again which would streamline all her activities and thus send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Mahire

texts.en: Mahire is 46 years old, married and the mother of one boy. She is from Sabirabad. Mehriban is a merchant. She is an intelligent and respected woman. All of the people in Sabirabad love her. Mahire her started her work about 10 years ago. She has gained a lot of experience at work. Currently she is not happy about her work situation and she wants to purchase a second new small piece of land in another area and hire a new worker. So she needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase a second new small piece of land in another area and hire a new worker.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is a married man with two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to have at least three motorcycles within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man with two children. He describes himself as self driven. He operates a retail business where he does photocopying, scanning, and printing of documents. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy printing papers and other stationery. He hopes that in the future he will have  a better life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy printing papers and other stationery

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 52 years old and has 5 children. Belinda is a married woman.

Belinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Belinda has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a very happy person. He is a typical farmer and businessman. He is doing zero grazing, fish farming, crop farming and agricultural business. He said that he is always thinking of how to save trees and the planet for the future generation, hence his idea to invest in a biodigester.

loans.use: To buy a biodigester for clean cooking fuel for his family

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Armando, de 55 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta un quinto grado luego ya no lo pudo hacer debido a la condición económica de sus familiares ya que era una familia bastante numerosa y con pocos recursos, sus hijos hoy ya mayores de edad tienen su propia familia vive con su esposa y una nieta 

Armando, se dedica a la agricultura en época de invierno cultiva dos manzanas de maiz esto lo aprendió de su padre, ademas por las tardes se dirige a la laguna que esta serca de su casa a la pesca artesanal esto también lo aprendió de sus padre ya que también a sus demás hermanos quienes también se an dedicado a esta misma actividad, esto lo hace casi todos los días por la tarde entrando la noche ya que es mas fácil hacerlo a esta hora ya que es la fuente principal de ingreso de su familia, 

Los fondos del credito serán destinados para comprar una lancha para la pesca ya que la que utiliza actualmente es rentada y le genera mas gastos y también comprar las redes ya que las que tiene actualmente están bastante terminadas y necesita sustituirla para tener mejores resultados

Armando, a futuro desea comprar un terreno para cultivar en un lugar propio y con ayuda del credito comprar la lancha para tener mejores resultados en la extracción del pescado
texts.en:
Armando, 55 years old, has reached up to fifth grade in schooling and then could no longer continue due to his family's economic condition. His family was fairly large and had few resources. His children are now adults and have their own families. He lives with his wife and a granddaughter.

Armando works in agriculture during the winter season. He grows corn on two blocks of land. He learned this from his father. In addition, in the evenings he works in a lake near his some. He does artisanal fishing, which he also learned from his father. His other brothers also work in the same activity. He does this almost every day in the afternoon and into the night, as it is easier to do during that time. This is this main source of income for his family.

The loan will be used to buy a boat for fishing, because the one that he currently uses is rented and generates more cost. He will also buy fishing nets, because the ones he currently has are very worn out, and need replacing for better results.

In the future Armando would like to buy land to have his own place to cultivate, and with the help of the loan to buy the fishing boat, he will have better results in extracting fish.

loans.use: to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en: Mehriban is 50 years old, divorced from her husband, and the mother of two boys. She is from Sabirabad. Mehriban is a merchant. She is an intelligent and skillful woman. Mehriban has developed and grown her business steadily. She started this business with a small amount of capital. She wants to purchase new store furniture (shelf, fridge etc.). So she needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase new store furniture (shelf, fridge etc.)

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 47 años de edad está casada y de esta  relación tiene 4 hijos de 30, 24, 20  y 17 años de edad, la menor estudian en colegio y dos de  ellos  aun viven en su casa. El marido  no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Flor es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar, ella se dedica al comercio,  todos los días instala un pequeño puesto cerca del municipio local, allí vende  aguas, golosinas, cigarrillos y otros cosas a las personas que a diario asisten a este lugar para cualquier gestión, allí ella también tiene una copiadora en la cual saca copias, lleva más de 4 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta y contribuir con los gastos del hogar ya que su marido no puede trabajar.
Este crédito es para comprar hojas de papel, materiales para copiadora, golosinas aguas entre otros. Esta casi desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran local y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer (The Loan Group to Assist Women) meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo district.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are hard working people whose work relates to the ocean in some way.

Flor lives here; she is 47 years old, married, and from this relationship has 4 children aged 30,  24, 20 and 17.  The youngest is studying in high school and two of the children still live at home.  Her husband does not work for health reasons.

Flor is a very hard-working woman who enjoys her work.  She earns a living in business.  Every day she puts up a small  stand near the local market. There she sells bottled water, sweets, cigarettes and other things to people who daily come to this place for whatever they need.  There Flor also has a copier and can make copies.  She has been in business for more than 4 years,which allows her to earn some money on her own and contribute to costs at home since her husband can no longer work.

This loan is for the purpose of buying paper, materials for the copier, sweets and bottled water among other items.  Flor has been with the Loan Group to Assist Women almost since its beginning and likes it because the loan allow her to finance her business.  Her dreams are to have a large business and provide better for her family.

loans.use: to buy paper, materials for a copier, sweets, bottled water, etc.

loans.name: Irade

texts.en:
Irade is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two kids. She is from Sabirabad. Irade is a merchant. She is a hardworking and successful person. She started her work 18 years ago. Ever since, Irade has developed and grown her business steadily. 

When she was young, she started this business with a small amount of capital. Irade has grown up in her village. She loves it and is attached to this place and her family. She has to take care of her family and that’s why she works hard. So she does this work with great love and passion. Now Irade wants to buy a few more foods and drinks and improve her grocery store. So she needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a few more foods and drinks and improve her grocery store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, soap, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, cooking fat and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Mityana Destiny School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Margaret. She is the head teacher of Mityana Destiny Junior School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mityana with 450 students. Mityana Destiny School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mityana Destiny School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Margaret ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Regina is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. For the past seven years, Regina has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which deals in chickens. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and feed to improve the chickens' growth, and will help Regina to generate greater profits and manage to take her kids to a better school. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her profits. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Regina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and feed to improve the chickens' growth

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water to sell. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en: Kalume is a married man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain which affects business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is in her early 20s and single. She has no children. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rosemary's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock of clothes and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva's support of their group. She used the profit to reinvest in the business and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date materials and suit materials for her tailoring business. She dreams of growing her business.  

She will share this loan with her loan group MT.Elgon which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date materials and suit materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is now living at the house of her parents, and her son is trying to have better luck at another place of the country. Nancy is still selling food, and she needs a loan to buy meat, chicken, rice, noodles and other supplies for her business. 

Nancy is alone. That is why she needs your help again. Nancy's son is working hard, but he is not making good money, so for now, he is not available for her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, noodles and other supplies for her business

loans.name: King Jesus School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sam. He is the Director of King Jesus Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Mubuku in Kasese with 500 students. King Jesus School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

King Jesus School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sam ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is single. He lives with his parents, but he helps them with the food and other expenses. Alex works as an engineer, but he needs a loan to buy wine because he will start to sell wine from Tarija by himself at his free time. Alex would like to have a liquor store in the future. He hopes you can help him. The wine from Tarija is the best of the country, so Alex thinks he has a chance to improve his situation.

loans.use: to buy wine for a business

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics and medicine. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics and medicine

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
The tsuishitoo group is composed of 4 extraordinary women. They run their own businesses (soft drinks, seamstress and pork meat) to support their husbands. Christiana, 49 is a group representative of tsuishitoo group, the mother of 1 beloved daughter and the wife of Issac.

Selling pork meat is the main source of income for Christiana and family. Her husband Isaac is 51 and working as a driver. Christiana sells pork meat in the neighborhood. Christiana buys the pigs, slaughters them and sells the pork. Since her customers love this meat she sells daily, her businss is well patronized.

One day a neighbor told her about tsuishitoo group and ID-Ghana loan program. They are requesting a loan of GHS 7,300 from Kiva through ID-Ghana. They hope the loan supported by ID-Ghana can boost their business thereby improve living standard.

loans.use: To buy the pigs for pork to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ever Melvi

texts.es:
Ever tiene 43 años y es un hombre casado, vive en Montería con su esposa e hijos; allí tiene un negocio desde hace dos años en el cual cría ganado, labor que aprendió por el mismo por el gusto que le tiene a esta labor. Su trabajo es el único sustento que tiene su familia, de manera que es muy importante para él. 

El quiere ver que su negocio perdure en el tiempo y le permita brindarle a su familia todo lo que necesita, es consiente que para que su negocio sea funcional debe invertir en él, para que así pueda crecer y brindarle las ganancias que necesita. Ever está pidiendo un préstamo que le permita comprar más marranos, y así aumentar la cantidad que posee en este momento. 

Ever tiene grandes sueños por los cuales se levanta cada día, para tratar de hacerlos realidad. Su vivienda no se encuentra en las mejores condiciones y le gustaría hacerle una reparaciones, para que su familia viva cómoda y segura. Ayuda a este responsable hombre a cumplir sus sueños, con un solo préstamo, de seguro estará más cerca.
texts.en:
Ever is 43 years old and a married man, living in Montería with his wife and children.  For two years there he has run a livestock breeding business, work that he learned on his own because he enjoys it.  His work is the only sustenance his family has and therefore it is very important to him.  

Ever wants to see his business last a long time and allow him to provide for his family all that they need.  He is aware that in order for his business to be functional he should invest in it, so that it can grow and deliver the profits he needs.  Ever is asking for a loan that will permit him to buy more pigs, increasing the amount he has at this time.  

Ever has great dreams that get him up every morning, in order to try to make them a reality.  His home is not in the best condition and he would like to make some repairs, so that his family will live comfortably and safely.  Help this responsible man fulfill their dreams; with just a loan, security will be closer.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Elena Teodora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 75 años de edad está casada y de esta  relación tuvo 12 hijos pero 4 fallecieron, los  8 que aun tiene son mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Elena además de ser una gran madre y esposa se dedica a la comercio, ella tiene un local  en su casa en el cual vende agua en bidón, sodas, jugos, hielo,  bolos de distintos sabores que ella prepara y otras bebidas, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en sus faenas de pesca, el con sus hijos se van de un día para otro y hasta dos días seguidos en una embarcación que tienen y así lograr una buena pesca, luego ya que regresan venden el fruto del mar a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar a los pescadores de la zona, ella lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y su marido casi toda su vida.
Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidón, sodas, jugos y materiales para la pesca. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The credit group "Para la ayuda de la mujer" gets together every 15 days in the canton Jaramijo, a place known for its beautiful beaches and where most people are hardworking and devoted to the sea. This is where Elena lives. She is 75 years old, married and mother of 12 children, 4 of whom passed away. The other 8 are adults and only one still lives at home. Her husband works in fishing. 

Elena is a great mother and wife. She also runs a business at her house where she sells water, sodas, juices, ice, flavored ice that she makes and drinks. She shares the loan with her husband to be used in his fishing activity. He works with their children and leave for 1 or 2 days in their boat. Once they are back they sell the product to salesmen. She has run the business for over 10 years and his husband has been a fisherman all his life. 

She will use the loan to buy water, sodas, juices and fishing materials. She has been with the group since the beginning and likes it because of the help it provides to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, juices and fishing materials.

loans.name: Libida Heroina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lívida, tiene 79 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun viven en su casa.
Doña Livida tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí el vende bebidas como gaseosas, aguas, cervezas y bocadillos de picar, son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su local a conversar y distraerse un rato y consumir lo que ella vende, los días que más vende son los fines de semana y allí es cuando más ganancias le quedan, lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar más agua, colas, cervezas y todo de lo que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se ayuda mucho. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group "Para la ayuda de la mujer" gets together every 15 days in the canton Jaramijo, a place known for its beautiful beaches and where most people are hardworking and devoted to the sea. This is where Libida lives. She is 79 years old, widow since her husband passed away some years ago, and mother of 5 adult children. One daughter still lives at home. 

Libida runs a small business at home, where she sells sodas, water, beer and sandwiches. Many people go to her house to chat, distract themselves and consume what she sells. Biggest sales are on weekends and that's when she obtains the highest income. She has been in the business for over 15 years and this activity allows her to get ahead. 

She will use the loan to buy more water, sodas, beer, etc. She has been with the group from the beginning and likes it because the loans help a lot. Her dream is to have good health to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: María Anabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 13 años de edad que estudia en colegio.
Doña María es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mas en lo que ella le encanta que es la cocina, ella  tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, allí  ella prepara meriendas los últimos cuatro días de la semana, solo vende en estos días porque es cuando más personas llegan hasta el lugar, sus platos que son del agrado de sus clientes y la prefieren por la variedad de platos que ella prepara y su sazón lo cual la hacen especial,  lleva más de  1 año en su negocio el cual le da para ganarse la vida para ella y su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar mariscos de toda clase y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los crédito siempre le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The loan group Para La Ayuda De La Mujer (Help for Women) meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. Jaramijo is known for its beautiful beaches where the majority of the locals are hard-working and have jobs that revolve around the sea.

This is where María lives. She is 37 years old, a single mother with a 13-year-old son who is studying at school. María is a woman who has always liked working and she particularly loves cooking. She has a small dining room in her home where she prepares snacks on the last four days of the week. She only sells her food on those days because it is when the largest number of people come to the area. Her customers enjoy her dishes and they come to her for the variety of dishes she offers and the seasoning that makes her food special. 

She has had the business for over a year and it provides a living for her and her son. The loan is to buy all kinds of seafood and other provisions to prepare the food. She has been in the loan group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans always help her a great deal. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy seafood and other supplies

loans.name: Lucia Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 41 años de edad está casada y de esta  relación tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Lucia es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en  trabajo, el tiene una embarcación en la cual todos los días  se dedican a la pesca,  el sale en la madrugada y regresa en la tarde, solo pesca camarón y uno que otro pez que caiga en las redes, como su embarcación es muy pequeña él no se aleja mucho de la costa, hay días que regresa más pronto porque la pesca ha sido muy buena pero en otros días no  puede ni salir por las mareas altas, así de esta forma el se las busca para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir. 
Este crédito es para comprar redes piolas, carnadas y otras cosas que él necesita para pescar. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre le ayudan con los créditos y las charlas de salud. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijos.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo region. The place is known for its beautiful beaches where the majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and dedicated to sea jobs.
This is where Lucia lives. She is 41 years old, married and has three children from that relationship who all go to school, aged 10, 9 and 5 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. Lucia is a great housewife and is getting the loan so that her husband can use it for his work. He has a boat from which he fishes every day, going out in the early morning and returning in the afternoon. He only fishes for prawns and the odd fish which falls into his net. As his boat is very small he doesn't go out very far from the coast. There are days when he returns earlier because the catch has been very good, but on other days he can't even go out because of the high waves, so for that reason she has turned to them so that her family does not lack what they need to live.
This loan is to buy string nets, bait and other things which he needs to fish. She has been in the credit group almost since the beginning and she likes it because they always offer her loans and have chats about health. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy string nets, bait, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Marangatu está en su ciclo 1, ellas son mujeres luchadoras que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos para poder dar a sus seres queridos una buena calidad de vida. 
La Sra. Balbina se dedica a la venta de golosinas, y bebidas  ella está muy contenta por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus clientes. Balbina pone su esfuerzo para poder ir capacitándose y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar golosinas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Marangatu is in its 1st cycle and composed of hardworking women who got together to help their loved ones and provide them with a good quality of life. Balbina sells candy and drinks and is very happy for the opportunity that she has to improve her life conditions and that of her customers. Balbina makes big efforts to improve the business and her quality of life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy candy, so that she can keep selling and fighting to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy for sale.

loans.name: Industrial Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 18 mujeres, todas ellas son mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, mujeres de una zona rural, de difícil acceso y donde todas están luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Ignacia es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, y comenta que por medio de sus ventas se gana la vida de una manera digna y sin privaciones. Ella está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar por medio de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo.
Ignacia  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser  calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y otros, de manera a poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of 18 women from the city of Curuguaty, from a rural zone which is difficult to get to. They are all working hard to be able to grow and move forward.

Ignacia is one of the members. She makes a living as a travelling sales woman selling all kinds of products. Through her sales she earns a living in a dignified way without any hardship. She is putting in all her effort so that she can develop and improve using the money that she will make. 

Ignacia is asking for this loan so that she can buy various products to sell such as shoes, clothes, stationary items and other products. This will allow her to continue making sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, stationary items and other products

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo de comité se llama Kuña Guapa está empezando su primer ciclo en el programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona rural en crecimiento. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, de este grupo ella se dedica a fabricar y vender tapetes, ella pide este préstamo en la compra de hilos y ropas usada en fardo para fabricar sus tapetes y posteriormente salir a la  venta de su producto.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por poder salir adelante y poder crecer como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee group called Kuña Guapa is starting its first loan cycle within the women's committee program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, a growing rural area.

Maria is one of the group's members. She is earning a living by manufacturing and selling rugs. She is requesting this loan to buy thread and used clothes in bundles to make her rugs to go and sell her products afterwards.

She is a very entrepreneurial woman, who is working hard to improve her financial situation and to be able to grow the way she does.

loans.use: to buy thread and used clothes in bundles to manufacture her rugs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beef, pork, seasonings and other goods.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Ayaovi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Ayaovi vit à Lomé et est âgée de 31 ans. Elle fait le commerce d’habits et plus ou moins de chaussures  pour gagner son revenu. Ayaovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter plus d’habits et chaussures en vue d’augmenter ses recettes ; ce qui permettra à Ayaovi de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants  et  assurer les dépenses régulières de la famille.
texts.en: Ayaovi is a 31-year-old married mother to two children who lives in Lomé. She sells clothing, and occasionally shoes, in order to earn a living. Ayaovi gets her supplies once per month from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothes and shoes so she can earn a bigger income. This will allow Ayaovi to better prepare her children for the coming school year and ensure that her family's expenses are met.

loans.use: to purchase 24 items of clothing and 10 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras se formó en la ciudad de Pilar, todas ellas son mujeres de familia, que luchan por poder ayudar a sus familias y seres queridos. Se pusieron como meta crecer, no solo en lo económica, sino también como persona.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Nelida quien tiene una despensa, que comenta que con mucho sacrificio empezó y hoy día ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella se unió al grupo para poder mejorar su vida, a través de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo.
La Señora Nelida  solicita este préstamo para la compra de fideos, azúcar, yerba, aceite, harina, y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras [engl. Enterprising Women] formed in the city of Pilar. They are all family women, who fight to be able to support their families and their loved ones. Their goal is to grow - not only economically, but also as persons.

Of the members, Nelida, owns a pantry store. She says, it took a lot of sacrifice to start it, but today she has good customers. She joined the group to improve her life through the training she will receive.

Nelida is requesting this loan to buy noodles, sugar, herbs, oil, flour, and so on, to be able to keep on selling the way she does.

She is thankful for receiving the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, herbs, oil, flour, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: 30 De Julio Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama 30 de julio es un grupo nuevo, están en el primer ciclo con 19 integrantes. Todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación. La mayoría de estas mujeres habitan en zonas rurales por lo que sus actividades se basan en la producción.
Entre ellas se destaca la señora Francisca quien desempeña el rol de presidenta en este grupo, se dedica a la plantación en una huerta, donde cultiva hortalizas en gran cantidad que una vez listas transporta al mercado para la venta. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abonos para poder seguir con su huerta, cultivando para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This committee is called '30 de julio' [30th July] and is a new group. This is their first loan cycle. Each of the 19 the members has an enterprising spirit and the desire to succeed. The majority of these women live in rural areas and therefore make a living from production. 

Among them Francisca stands out. She plays the role of president for this group and makes a living by growing crops in her vegetable garden, where she grows a great quantity of vegetables, taking them to market to sell when they are ready. She is a very determined, enterprising woman and she wants to move forward. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy seeds and fertilizers and be able to continue growing produce in her vegetable patch so she can continue selling.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to cultivate her vegetable garden

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement a été créé le 15 décembre 2009 et regroupe 8 femmes. Depuis plus de 5 ans ces femmes travaillent ensemble et ont comme principale activité le commerce de détail.

Amy est notre emprunteuse en vedette. elle se trouve à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche.Elle est mariée et est mère de deux enfants.

Amy est commerçante, elle achète des chaussures en gros pour les revendre en détail. Elle fait aussi de la couture.

Avec ce prêt l'emprunteuse compte acheter des chaussures pour un valeur de 250000f et des fournitures pour son atelier de couture.

Les bénéfices seront réinvestis dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
This eight-woman group was created on 15th December 2009. For over five years, these women have been working together. Their main source of income is through running retail business.

Amy is our star borrower. She is the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised. She is a married mother to two children.

Amy works as a vendor. She purchases shoes in bulk and then sells them at retail. She also earns a living as a seamstress.

With this loan, this borrower plans on purchasing 250,000 FCFA-worth of shoes, as well as supplies for her sewing shop.

The profits from this loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Señoras Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma quien tiene cría de gallinas caseras y venta de huevos quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel medio de ingresos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Norma solicita  este préstamo para mejorar su gallinero, como así también para poder comprar balanceados para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is part of the poverty elimination programme, where each member is working her hardest in order to improve her living conditions and to help her loved ones.

One member of the group is Norma who raises hens and sells eggs. At the last survey, she was found to be living in 'Level 2' poverty, meaning that she has an average income. Norma is hard-working and plucky; she wants to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Norma is applying for this loan in order to improve her chicken coop and to buy feed. She can thus continue with her sales.

loans.use: to repair a hen coop and to buy feed.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza  tiene 21 integrantes, están en su ciclo número 12° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Susana, una mujer muy destacada por ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que se unió a este grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que el carbón es muy comprado y con su negocio se gana la vida de manera honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" group has 21 members who are on their twelfth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme. The are from the city of Itá, where each one works and helps each other to move forward. The members are doing the poverty elimination survey in order to work hard to improve their living conditions.

One member of the group is Susana, well-known as a plucky and enterprising member. She wants to move forward, which is why she joined this group. Susana makes a living selling coal, and says that it is going very well as coal sells well and that the business is allowing her to earn an honest living.

Susana is applying for this loan in order to buy coal in bulk and thus help to continue with her sales. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and moving forward.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Dukundane Group

texts.en:
Dukundane is a group led by Grace, who is 35 years old. The group name means “Love each other” in English. The group members sell various items and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

Grace is married and has five children aged 6 to 18.

She sells food and has been doing a business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, maize and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, maize and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo María Auxiliadora  de la Ciudad de Itá está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en la cual trabaja día a día para poder crecer y salir adelante, y con ello poder ayudar a su familia. Ella está luchando para poder crecer y mejorar su negocio, ya que de esa forma puede dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder continuar con sus ventas, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, bebidas y otros. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Group from the city of Itá is in its 10th loan cycle with the women's committee program, where everyone works to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, striving to improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Norma. She has a well-stocked store where she works every day so she can grow and get ahead, so she can help her family. She is struggling to grow and improve her business, so she can give her family everything she couldn't have. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies, such as vegetables, meats, baked goods, drinks, etc. so she can keep up her sales. They all appreciate the opportunity they are getting to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Teresa, a 56-year-old mother of five children, who resides in the Nandihills area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Teresa has been practicing farming for the last 10 years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. Teresa enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. Having the traits of a go-getter, Teresa has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to start the shop and make her dream come true. 

With your loan, Teresa will be able to improve her income level and to comfortably take care of her family. Teresa’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is 20 years old. He is living with a woman of the same age, and the couple have two children. The oldest is 3 years old and the other is one year old. The couple love a lot their children so they are ready to work harder.

Vladimir works as a mason and his girlfriend sells sandwiches.

Vladimir needs a loan to pay the maintenance of the car that is the property of the couple. Vladimir would like to work as a taxi driver during his free time, so he hopes you can help him.

Vladimir is in the picture with his girlfriend and one of his children. They are living at the house of Vladimir parents

loans.use: to pay the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 38 years old. She is married and she is the mother of two kids; she pays rent. She sells bed sheets and bed covers. Her husband is an electrician.

Marcelina needs a loan to buy more bed covers for her business. She hopes you can help her because she wants to increase her sales.

Marcelina is responsible and she is healthy. She would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy bed covers for her business

loans.name: 15 De Enero Group

texts.en:
San Pedro Jocopilas is a town located in the Guatemalan state of Quiche, northwest of Guatemala City. The town is known for its cotton weavings, palm hats and adobe bricks. They are also known for selling oils, paints and soaps.

A dedicated group of small businesswomen formed the local Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “15 de Enero” (January 15th). The women, besides wanting micro-credit loans to develop their small businesses, also have dreams of empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. They have formed “15 de Enero” to expand their small businesses, increase profits and meet their household expenses, including sending their children to school,.

Santos is 32 years old and was elected President of the group. Her business is animal husbandry, especially raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy four more pigs to raise and the sell to restaurants. Santos shares her earnings with her children, who are all attending school. Her desire and expectation is that they all reach a high level of education, a goal that she was unable to attain.

Unfortunately, the majority of the women who make up “15 de Enero” were unable to attend school. Like most Mayan women, they were required from early childhood to work hard and help meet the financial needs of their families. The skills they learned as children provided the foundation for them to develop a strong work ethic, and perhaps their own businesses as they got older. The educational component of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge (small loans + education) gave them the tools to learn and polish business skills (pricing, marketing, accounting, budgeting, customer service), leadership, self-esteem and empowerment, as well as hygiene, health and women’s rights. Like a plant in need of water and fertilizer, the “Microcredit Plus” Program gives them essential nutrients to grow and expand in their personal and business lives.
