The women of “15 de Enero” are very grateful to all the KIVA investors from around the world who have generously provided funds for these essential loans. Thank you KIVA investors for your kindness and vision for these ladies!!!

loans.use: to buy four more pigs to raise and the sell to restaurants.

loans.name: Ginorah

texts.en:
Ginorah is a single woman. She has five children.

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy tailoring materials.

Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en:
FEHMEEDA, a 35-year-old poor woman, is living along with her two sons, two daughters and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her living condition is not up to the mark; she is passing her life hand to mouth.

Her husband owns a local cable operator business; he broadcasts t.v. channels to his subscribed customers. He wants to increase the number of subscribers but does not have enough cash on hand to buy cable so he can easily cover the maximum area and can provide the services.

This is the reason FEHMEEDA did humble request a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a cable roller and can easily reach the maximum consumers.

FEHMEEDA thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a cable roller for her husband's t.v. channel services providing business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single woman. She describes herself as honest.

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.en:
Santa Clara la Laguna is situated high in the mountains above Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.  It is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “El Esfuerzo”  meaning “Strong (spirited) Effort” that is made up of eight very hardworking women who formed the group to educate themselves, secure loans, strengthen their small businesses and improve their lives.  They are seeking a second loan from Kiva investors in order to expand their small businesses and take advantage of a growing market in their area.

24-year-old Maria is a member of the group with only a sixth grade education.  She buys and sells fresh vegetables that she sells from her house.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy a greater variety of vegetables like potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and cabbage.  Besides the loan, Maria will also be able to participate in the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge that combines microloans with education.  

At each monthly meeting of “El Esfuerzo”, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator presents useful and timely information on a topic, such as women’s and children’s health and hygiene, the use of medicinal plants, or business administration (accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and pricing). Maria and her friends in the Trust Bank will be able to be able to use this new information in their lives on a daily basis. The lessons help them develop their self-esteem and empower themselves. 

The ladies are very grateful to the Kiva investors around the world who have funded their much-needed loans and helped to provide them with a better and brighter future. Thank you, lenders, for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: to expand her business and buy a greater variety of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
En este grupo llamado San Agustin todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cinco señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Graciela, una de las integrantes solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y otros, y de esa forma poder luchar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Graciela es una persona muy sacrificada que se está haciendo conocida en el barrio y de esa forma está creciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar un poco más su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
In this group, called San Agustin, everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are part of the poverty elimination program, in which five of the women are below the poverty line, that is to say, in extreme poverty. 

Graciela, one of the members, is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, meats, condiments, etc. so she can make meals. By doing so, she can strive to improve her living conditions. Graciela is a self-sacrificing woman who is becoming well-known in the neighborhood, so her business is growing. 
.
She appreciates the opportunity she is getting to be able to improve her business venture a bit more.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products and equipment for salon use.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 12 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su propia casa, comenta que poco a poco se va abriendo camino y hoy día ya es conocida en el barrio y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como verduras, carne, frutas, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre (8th of December) group is in its 4th loan cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where 12 members find themselves under the poverty line, i.e. extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Ramona, who has a well-stocked store in her own home. She says that little-by-little she is making her way and today she is known in the neighborhood and has a very good clientele. She is a fighter that wants to improve her living conditions. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest into buying supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruits, drinks and others, so that she will can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, drinks and others.

loans.name: 19 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres que están esforzándose por poder salir adelante y crecer. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laudelina, quien es presidenta del grupo, y una mujer muy sacrificada.
Ella vende ropas variadas y por medio de su negocio se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, y con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda a su familia. Laudelina comenta que le está yendo muy bien y que así se está manteniendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group is in the poverty elimination program. They are women who are striving to be able to get ahead and grow. One of the members is Laudelina, who is the president of the group and a very selfless woman. She sells various clothing and through her business she makes a living in a dignified and honest way. With the earnings that she gets, she can help her family. Laudelina says that it is going very well for her and she is maintaining her business. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and others, and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants and others.

loans.name: Iloka's Group

texts.en:
Iloka is a 42-old-woman and a mother of six. She works as a council traffic controller. Her husband is a farmer and they all live together happily at a rented apartment in the community.

Annually, she and her husband contribute funds together to process, store and sell palm oil to raise more income to support their family, especially for paying rent and their children's school fees. She spends most of her weekends to support her husband at the mill because that is the only time she has to work on her palm products considering her busy weekly schedule.

A portion of this loan will help her and her group members purchase fresh palm fruits this season to process for storage. The entire group thanks all Kiva lenders for reading through and also supporting their loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh palm fruits for milling and oil production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in a family house in Mamobi, a suburb of Accra. He is sixty-nine (69) years old. He is a retired policeman. There is no toilet facility in Daniel's house so his family use the commercial toilet and have to walk for sometime before getting access to one. 

Daniel is requesting this loan to enable him to build a modern toilet facility for the household. His children and entire family have agreed to make a monthly contribution to repay the loan when granted.

loans.use: To build a toilet facility for his household.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a landlord in Nima. He lives with his family and some few tenants. He is thirty-eight (38) years old. David is a hardworking man. He is a carpenter. There is no toilet facility in his house and he wants to build one for his family. 

He has agreed with one of his brothers to take the initiative to construct a modern toilet facility for the household. With this loan, he will be able to construct the toilet facility and his brother has agreed to support him in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To build a modern toilet facility for his family and tenants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for upcoming trade shows that would benefit his company.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a proud owner of a Curves Franchise gym, an establishment dedicated to empowering women every day through wellness and fitness. Leah previously was an employee at her gym and decided to become an owner when her former boss decided to retire.

Over the past years, Leah has successfully added several programs that have helped her gym grow and further evolve. Her most recent addition has been the Jenny Craig program, which allows Leah to reach women in her community who are working on weight loss and fitness goals.

One of Leah’s biggest challenges has been to increase her gym membership numbers. Luckily, she is able to rely on member referrals when her members are successful. However, she is looking for other ways to drive more members in the door.

Leah is currently seeking a loan that would allow her to upgrade the equipment in her center. Her goal is to give her gym a “fresh” look. In the future she hopes to grow her already expanding membership base and reach new clientele.

loans.use: to purchase modern fitness equipment for her gym.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist with renovations and expansion in her salon.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian, 35, is an experienced maize (corn) and vegetable farmer, with a family of 12 from Chibombo District, Zambia.

He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide milling service to over 150 families in his community. The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour, which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Chibombo District grow maize on their small farms and store it for use as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called nshima.

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Fabian's community and has determined that the location for this equipment is good. There is a maize mill about 1.5 km away, but it is often broken down. Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers such as Fabian, as it allows him to diversify his business. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Fabian will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm and provide training on how to use and maintain it.

This loan will help Fabian on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year. It is for this reason that Fabian is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide milling services to over 150 families in his community.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in a family house in Nima west, a suburb of Accra. She is forty-four (44) years of age and has six children. She is a trader and sells clothes at the Nima market. There is no toilet facility in Hawa's family house so they resort to the public toilet which is not very convenient for them because of the long queues they sometimes join before having access to the commercial toilet.

The family have come together and have decided to have their own toilet facility. Hawa, as the leader of the family, is requesting this loan to enable them build a modern toilet facility for the household. They will be able to repay the loan through contributions from the members of the family.

loans.use: To construct a modern toilet facility for her household.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is fifty years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader and sells foodstuffs at the Makola market in Accra. George is a water vendor and also makes and sells pavement blocks, concrete blocks and other construction materials. He has done this business for eight years now. 

Water is very essential when it comes to making blocks therefore George wants to take this loan and use it to purchase a poly tank to store water. The poly tank will help him to store the water for both his blocks factory and for his water vending business. He believes this will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a poly tank to store water for his water vending and construction business.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre es un grupo nuevo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Entre el trabajo que ellas hacen se dedican a actividades variadas, una de ellas es la Sra. Nice quien tiene una despensa en su casa donde vende variados productos. Cabe destacar que las integrantes de este grupo han trabajado y logrado unirse más entre ellas. Nice es una mujer muy emprendedora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, frutas y otros, de manera a poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The 8 de Diciembre (8th of December) is a new group. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where two women find themselves below the poverty line, i.e. extreme poverty. The women make a living doing various jobs. One of them is Nice, who has a store in her house where she sells various products. It is worth saying that the members of this group have worked and managed to join themselves more. Nice is a very entrepreneurial woman who is fighting to be able to grow and get ahead. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy various supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meats, breads, fruits and others. This way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, breads, fruits and others.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Alegria está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir luchando y creciendo por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Celsa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, para damas y niños, ya que con ello podrá continuar con su negocio de venta de ropas. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y se está esforzando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
La Alegria (The Happiness) group is in its 2nd loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead and improve their quality of life. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where three women find themselves below the poverty line, that is to say fighting and growing to improve their living conditions. 

Celsa is asking for a loan to buy a variety and more quantity of items of clothing such as pants and shirts for women and children. With the loan, she will be able to continue with her business selling clothing. She is a fighter who, little-by-little, has made her way and she is striving to be able to give her family everything that she never had.

loans.use: to buy clothing items such as pants and shirts for women and children.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es un grupo unido, está en el ciclo uno del programa de comités, son 19 mujeres que se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana quien solicita de este préstamo para la inversión en su negocio que es la elaboración y venta de empanadas y venta de bebidas como  gaseosas.
Rossana comenta que empezó su negocio con muy poco, pero poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que vende.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) is a united group. It is in its first cycle of the committee program. They are 19 women who find themselves part of the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Rossana who is requesting this loan to invest in her business making and selling empanadas and selling drinks like sodas.

Rossana says that she began her business with very little but gradually the path opened up and today she has very good customers who always buy the products she sells from her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make empanadas like meat, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Aniphal

texts.en:
Aniphal is a 27-year-old hard working married woman with 2 children who attend school in Hoima Uganda. 

She sells salt, sugar, soap and other items. In order to supplement her income, she grows cassava and beans. She  intends to expand her business into a fully stocked mini-supermarket to reap more profits. She will use the loan to buy salt and sugar.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Kibeedi Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Robert is a married man who operates a produce store to buy and sell maize, rice, and beans. He also farms to obtain additional income. Due to the fact that he is the sole provider for his family, he plans to educate his children to university level. 

He complains of the unpredictable weather conditions which affect his returns. Robert intends to use the loan to buy maize. He is a member of Kibeedi Tukurakurane group where members guarantee each other to get loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Elena, que se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, es una muy buena vendedora, y es por ello que se ha hecho de mucha clientela y se gana los medios para poder mantener a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas para la venta, como ser manzanas, piñas, bananas y otras frutas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
There are 17 women who are members of this group. They are in the poverty elimination program; each one is fighting to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

One of those who is a group member is Elena, who works selling fresh fruit. She is a very good saleswoman and for this she has made a large customer base and earns the means to be able to support her family.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fresh fruit to sell such as apples, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and help her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruit to sell such as apples, pineapples, bananas and other fruit.

loans.name: Switzer

texts.en:
Switzer used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He grows tea and sells firewood. He faces challenges of weather conditions that limit crop production. He works very hard to provide an education for all his children. 

Switzer needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima used the previous loan to buy a cow. She has a retail shop and also runs a restaurant and rears cattle to make more income. She faces challenges of limited space and lack of enough water and pastures. 

However she is working very hard to make sure that she can buy a piece of land where she can expand her farm. Naima is requesting a loan to buy more land so she can expand her animal farm.

loans.use: to buy more land to expand her animal farm.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy used the previous loan to buy more land for family settlement. In addition to selling popcorn and groundnuts, he has a retail shop that brings him additional income. 

Jimmy started these businesses with the hope of employing himself and being able to look after his family as a loving parent. He encounters difficulties due to price fluctuations and high rental fees. 

He has asked for another loan to buy salt, utensils, ground nuts and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, utensils, ground nuts and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Top Hill Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Eric is a member of Top Hill Tweyimukye Group where each member guarantees the others for a loan facility. He is aged 26, has 3 children and is living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He sells bananas and owns a retail shop that provides him with additional income. He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinder expansion of his business. Besides that he has hopes of building a permanent house for his family. 

Eric has requested a loan to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Los Cedrales Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Los Cedrales” forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son de Ciudad del Este, cada una está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que está en una pobreza extrema, pero luchando por mejorar. Ella se dedica a la peluquería, tiene variada clientela que siempre acude a su salón de belleza para poder acceder a su buen servicio.
Silvia pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes y otros productos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio, y de esa forma poder continuar con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Los Cedrales is part of the poverty elimination program. They are from Ciudad del Este, each one is fighting to be able to improve her living conditions. 

One of the members is Silvia who, on her questionnaire, showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say extreme poverty, but struggling to improve. She works in a beauty salon. She has a variety of customers who always come to her beauty salon to be able to get her good service.

Silvia asks for this loan to be able to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other products, to be able to continue giving good service and in this way be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes and other products.

loans.name: Aramathan

texts.en:
Aramathan is 58 years old, He  lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy sugar to sell. He is married with 2 children attending school. He operates a retail store with general merchandise selling items like sugar and cooking oil among others. He also earns a side income from rentals. 

He is a hard working man though facing a challenge of market competition and lack of a refrigerator which means he can not offer his clients cold drinks that they usually ask for. He hopes to expand his business and look after his children.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more soap, salt and a fridge for his retail merchandise shop.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt and a refrigerator for his retail merchandise shop.

loans.name: Lance

texts.en:
Lance is originally from Miami, but moved to Orlando from Oklahoma in 2013. He runs his personal fitness business on his own and has been in business for one year. Through Lance’s personal fitness instruction and program he has witnessed growth and success in each of his clients. The greatest success he has had was with one particular client who was able to lose 60 lbs within a 3 month period through following his program. 

Lance’s business is a passion of his and an idea he has planned and prepared for over the past 7 years. The biggest difficulty he has run into has been the inability to invest in the growth of his company through advertising and marketing sources. 

Lance is currently seeking a loan to invest in the growth of his company and also purchase new equipment to help diversify workouts for his clients. His vision for the future is growth and development for his business. He would like to expand his business throughout the Florida state and also would like to be able to reach as many clients as possible through branding, merchandising and digital training courses as well.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising services and to purchase additional equipment for his business.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Lucas” tiene 17 integrantes, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana quien está en un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a vender ropas variadas, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros y de esa forma poder seguir teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called San Lucas has 17 members. They are part of the poverty elimination program; each one is fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

One of the members is Rossana, whose poverty level is within level one, which is to say extreme poverty. She works selling a variety of clothing and through her work she has the means to be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, and more, and in this way be able to continue having the means to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and more.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Marcos” es un grupo Nuevo, formado en ciudad del este, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabriela quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, comenta que poco a poco fue montando su negocio, y que hoy ya le permite ganarse la vida honradamente. Es muy Buena en sus ventas, es por ello que ha crecido bastante.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que pone todo de si para mejorar. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, frutas, bebidas, panificados y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene hacienda.
texts.en:
The group called San Marcos is a new group, created in Ciudad del Este. They are in the poverty elimination program; they are very hard-working and determined women. 

One of the members is Gabriela who has a well-stocked store. She says that, little by little, she established her business and that today it allows her to earn her living honestly. She is very good with her sales, and for this it has grown so much. 

She is a very determined woman who puts her all into improving. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, meat, fruit, drinks, baked goods, and other products to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, fruit, drinks, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: Orokia est âgée de 41 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est : son expérience, le respect et la qualité du produit. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter le matériel pour faire du savon. L’utilité du prêt c’est de pouvoir approvisionner en matériel pour le savon afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Orokia is 41 and married with five children. She has been working in her business for 10 years. Her long experience, her respect and the quality of her merchandise are the roots of her success. She requests this loan to buy the materials necessary for making soap.  She will use the loan to stock up her business in soap making materials in order to reinforce it. She has already received one previous loan that she repaid on the date anticipated by ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy materials for making soap.

loans.name: Bendia 27 (1) Group

texts.fr: Korotimi est âgée de 25 ans mariée mère de 6 ans. Elle exerce son activité depuis 19 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est le respect et la qualité de la marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de céréale. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Korotimi is 25 and married with a child of six. She has been working in her business for 19 years. Her respect and the quality of her merchandise are the roots of her success. She requests this loan to buy five sacks of cereals. She will use the loan to stock up her business in order to reinforce it. She has already received one previous loan that she repaid on the date planned by ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of cereals.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos dependientes que estudian. la señora se dedica a la agricultura conjuntamente con la familia, produciendo papa y oca como los principales productos agrícolas de mayor demanda en el mercado. Los ingresos económicos que genera son a través de la producción y venta de productos agrícolas que son también el sustento para su alimentación (auto consumo). La señora Juana requiere un préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa, productos agroquímicos y herramientas agrícolas, gastos de tractor agrícola y pago al personal eventual. Por último, la señora Juana se sintió esperanzada por la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo para cubrir sus necesidades; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, incrementará la producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: Juana lives and works in Colomi, is married, and has 3 dependent children who are students. She works in agriculture with her family, producing potatoes and oca root as their primary agricultural products of greatest demand in the market. The income that she generates is through the production and sale of agricultural products that are also the sustenance for their nutrition (they eat them). Juana needs a loan to purchase organic manure (hen droppings), potato seeds, agricultural chemicals and agricultural tools, pay the tractor expenses and pay people who work occasionally. Finally, Juana feels hopeful about the opportunity to get a loan to cover her needs because with the purchase of the agricultural supplies, she will increase the production and have greater sales which will improve her standard of living and her social situation to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (manure) to increase the production and have greater sales to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Santa Ines” está en su ciclo 16 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3  de las 18  señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, se encuentran en una situación de pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, una mujer muy trabajadora, que se abre camino para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de la lavandería que tiene. Comenta que lava ropa de sus clientes todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jabón en polvo, jabones en maza, suavizantes de ropas y otros, de manera a poder seguir haciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The Santa Ines group is in its 16th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all commit to working and helping each other to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire where 3 out of the 18 women are below the poverty line, which is to say that are in a situation of extreme poverty.

One of the members is Gloria, a very hard-working woman who makes her way to be able to help her family through a laundry which she has. She says that she washes her customers' clothing every day from the very early hours and always puts forth her best effort to be able to satisfy her customers.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase powdered soap, bar soap, fabric softeners and more, so as to be able to continue giving her customers good service. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and be someone in life.

loans.use: to purchase powdered soap, bar soap, fabric softener, and more.

loans.name: Lagm-Pengwendé 3 Group

texts.fr: Azéta âgée de 44 ans marié mère de 4 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est : son expérience, le respect du client et la qualité de la marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter du céréale (10 sacs). L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et à rembourser à la date prévue ACFIME
texts.en: Azéta is 44 and married with four children. She has been working in her business for 15 years. Her long experience, the respect that her clients have for her and the quality of her merchandise are the reasons for her success. She requests this loan to buy cereals (10 sacks).  She will use the loan to stock up her business in sufficient quantity in order to reinforce it. She has already received one previous loan that she repaid on the date planned by ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy cereals (10 sacks).

loans.name: Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre “Laboriosas “está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas integrantes se encontraban por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sergia quien a través de su despensa tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles la calidad de vida que precisan y que no pasen por necesidades. Sergia es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y se está esforzando por hacerlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, panificados, y otros, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group with the name Laboriosas is in its 10th loan cycle in the enterprising women's committee program, where they are completing the poverty elimination questionnaire, where some of the members are below the poverty line, which is to say in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Sergia who, through her store, has the means to be able to help her family and give them the quality of life that they need and that they don't lack anything. Sergia is a very determined and enterprising woman who wants to improve her living conditions and is working hard to do so. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, fruits, drinks, baked goods, and more and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, drinks, baked goods and other products to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña katupyry  está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y sabanas, y comenta que por medio de su negocio se gana la vida para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella comenta que está contenta por formar parte del programa del comité de mujeres ya que de esa forma podrán seguir creciendo. 
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la veta, y también para la compra de sabanas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry group is in the poverty elimination program. They are 17 hard-working woman who put their efforts into being able to get ahead. 

One of the members is Maria, who works selling clothing and sheets, and says that through this business she earns her living to be able to help her family and give them a dignified life free of want. She says that she is happy to be part of the women's committee program since in this way they can continue growing. 

Maria asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of clothing to sell and also to purchase sheets. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue improving each day.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Corazón de Jesús está en su 4to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por mejorarla.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, una de las integrantes, la Sra. Katerin se gana la vida de una manera humilde por medio de su servicio de manicura, ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre les pide su servicio de manicura y gracias a ese trabajo se gana la vida de una manera honesta.
Katerin lucha por poder crecer y mejorar cada día, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, alicates, acetonas y otros productos para poder seguir dando una buena atención a sus clientes. Está contenta por formar parte del programa de comités, ya que a través de el podrá crecer.
texts.en:
The Corazón de Jesús group is in its 4th loan cycle in the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are also in the poverty elimination program which allows them to know the living situation of each one of them and, according to that, work hard to improve it.

Through her efforts and continuous work, one of the members, Katerin, earns a living in a humble way through her manicure service. She says that she has a very good customer base who always asks for her manicure services and, thanks to this work, she earns her living in an honest way. 

Katerin struggles to be able to grow and improve each day and asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of nail polish, clippers, nail polish remover and other products to be able to give good customer service. She is happy to be part of the committee program since, through this, she will be able to grow.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, clippers, nail polish removers and other products.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Veuve, Akouvi est une femme de 52 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses six enfants. Pour  venir en aide aux besoins de la famille, Akouvi vend de la farine du manioc qu’elle fabrique son quartier. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et les revend dans son quartier en réalisant un bon bénéfice grâce à son activité génératrice de revenu. Akouvi désire ce microcrédit pour acheter des maniocs afin de gagner plus de revenus et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouvi is a widow. She is 52 and lives in Adidogomé with her six children. To provide for the needs of the family, Akouvi sells manioc flour that she prepares in her district. Akouvi stocks up twice a month at the market and makes her sales locally making a good profit thanks to her income generating business. Akouvi requests this micro-credit to buy manioc in order to make more income and promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two loads of manioc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 75 years old and he works as a driver. He has been in this activity for over 10 years and he needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. 

He hopes you can help him because he is a widow. He has a daughter but she has her own expenses and can't help him although she gives him a place to live. Victor is living with his daughter and he helps her with the expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Danmabé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 56 ans, Danmabé est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses cinq enfants. Danmabé vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier afin de trouver son gain. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Danmabé s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Danmabé demande ce crédit pour commander des charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Danmabé is 56. Danmabé is married, and she lives in Adidogomé with her five children. Danmabé  sells charcoal in her district to earn a living. To enable her business to run correctly, Danmabé, stocks up from her suppliers once a month. Danmabé requests this loan to order charcoal to allow her to make more income to help her husband provide for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 11 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en:
Saverino is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He buys and sells coffee and maize (produce) alongside livestock rearing and crop growing which helps him earn a living. 

He believes he can develop and become a modern farmer but his main challenge is inadequate capital on top of unpredictable weather changes. In spite of this, Saverino is determined to take his business to another level.

He has requested for a loan to buy seeds to plant next season.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant next season.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years;. It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing old, and their needs as well. 

Mumtaz has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing some money has become short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. Mumtaz is a 52-years old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her son's transportation services. .

loans.name: Feledian

texts.en:
Feledian is a 49-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in livestock rearing which she supplements with farming especially growing bananas and beans. This has enabled her to develop herself and educate her children. 

She wishes to become a modern farmer and a renowned business woman but her main barrier is inadequate capital and bad weather that limits her business growth.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows and calves to add to the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows and calves to add to the farm.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 48 ans, Kossiwa réside à Adidogomé où elle excerce son commerce de revendeuse de charbon de bois. Kossiwa achète ses marchandises au marché deux fois par mois et les revendent à domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et de bien s’occuper de son enfant
texts.en: Kossiwa is a single mother with one dependent child. She is 48. Kossiwa lives in Adidogomé where she has a business selling charcoal. Kossiwa buys her merchandise at the market twice a month, and sells her goods from home. Kossiwa requests this loan to order sacks of charcoal in order to answer her customers’ expectations and take good care of her child.

loans.use: To buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Linthoingambi Nupi Lup Group

texts.en:
Pishak runs her own weaving business in Manipur, India. Through her business, she earns Rs. 4500 per month. She is a mother of 3 children and she toils daily to meet the expenses of her family. She is married to a cultivator, whose income is not enough to sustain the family of 6. 

Pishak wants to do more and she feels expanding her weaving business would help her do that. She needs a loan of Rs. 10,000 to expand her business. With the help of the loan, she will be able to sell loin cloths, towels, wrappers, etc. After the income, she hopes to earn Rs. 9000 per month.

Pishak is the leader of a group of 5 women – Pishak, Sachirani, Sumati, Romi and Tombi. While Sachirani, Sumati and Romi run a weaving business just like Pishak, Tombi runs a rice selling business. These women need a group loan of Rs. 50,000 to expand their respective businesses. The loan will help them contribute more to their family income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To expand her weaving business and sell loin cloths, towels, etc.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 54 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a silk weaver, her husband is a construction worker, and her two children are factory laborers. All of them can earn approximately $ 21 per day. 

Now, she would like to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. She lacks the finances, so she is applying for a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motorcycle for her children and improve their traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to build a proper house and support her youngest child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Ali has been working hard to manage his produce business. 

To help expand his business, Ali has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of produce and will help Ali to generate greater profits and increase stock. Ali hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Ali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more stock of produce

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Bena has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items, and will help Bena to generate greater profits and increase capital. Bena hopes that in the future she will be able to pay school fees for her chilren. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bena who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase stock of more food and drinks

loans.name: Sreynit

texts.en:
Sreynit is 21 years old, a single freshman who resides with her parents in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Her father is a rice farmer, and her mother has a grocery business. 

She is taking a midwifery major. Because she is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from her first through her third year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, Sreynit will be able to provide her with a skill to build her future. 

After graduation, she wants to work in a health center or clinic so she will be able to help others and save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees in Midwifery from her first through her third year

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat, 58, is a Palestinian refugee. He is married and the father of one child. The family lives in a camp in Lebanon.

Because of the limited work opportunities afforded these refugees, Izzat has worked for the past 27 years as an auto mechanic. His income is low, and this is making it increasingly difficult for him to cover his family’s expenses. 

For this reason Izzat is acquiring a loan through Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate his work and life. 
He hopes to stay capable of supporting his family and providing them with the necessary living needs.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate his work and life

loans.name: Ragheda

texts.en:
Ragheda is a 53-year-old married mother of three children. She started, five years ago, baking Saj bread (is a type of unleavened flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle) to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Ragheda is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. She has professional skills in this domain and ten years of experience for she learned it from her mother. 

Today, Ragheda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying the necessary raw materials (wheat flour, oil, table salt,etc..) and gas
Ragheda hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials (wheat flour, oil, table salt,) and gas

loans.name: Agustino

texts.en:
Agustino is a hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings for the next planting season. He also rears goats to earn an extra income with the aim of developing and educating his children. 

He wishes to be a prominent modern farmer but his main challenges are inadequate capital and bad seasons. 

He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his garden so as to increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy manure for his garden so as to increase its productivity.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a  married with six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase twenty sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married with two children, one of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a farm supplies shop selling things like pesticides which he supplements with crop growing. With this, he has been able to develop himself and sustain his family. 

His vision is to be a popular and  prominent businessman but his main limitation is inadequate capital to buy enough stock to supply to his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy more farm supplies like fertilizers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies like fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 68 ans, Afi  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants à sa charge. Afi est très dynamique et vend des pommades et des produits de soins en parcourant son quartier. Afi trouve un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des  crèmes, des parfums et des pommades pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Afi is 68. She is married and she lives in the Adidogomé district with her four dependent children. Afi is very energetic and sells ointments and beauty products travelling around her district. Afi manages to make sufficient profit to help the family and stocks up twice a month at the market.  Afi requests this loan to order beauty cream, perfume, and ointment to sell so she can earn even more income.

loans.use: to buy three dozen units of cream, 15 bottles of perfume and 11 units of ointment.

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Roth’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Roth makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 39, living with her two sons and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been running a mobile phone shop for eight years and cherishing his entire family alone. He troubleshoots the mobiles and sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. He also provide photocopier services to his customers.

Nowadays a lot of demand increases of accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. He does not have savings to further invest into business because he already has spent his all savings for household expenses. 

Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can be empowered to buy additional mobile accessories, extra credit for recharge facility and papers for photocopy machine. She thanks Kiva and to its field partner over this honorable support.

loans.use: to support her husband in purchasing additional mobile accessories, extra credit for recharge facility and papers for photocopy machine.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a 39-years old lady, mother of four children. Her two children go to school, and one of them is too young. 
Her husband has been assembling spare parts into new sewing machine and been providing services for repairing sewing machines as well. He is expert in his work and has been doing this business for many years. He wants to make new sewing machines to sell but he does not have cash in hand to buy sewing machine’s spare parts such as buttonhole foot, over casting foot, zipper foot, blind stitch foot, button fitting foot, bobbin, spring action quilting foot, quilt guide for foot holder etc.

Therefore, Rukia requested a loan to buy parts of sewing machine so that her husband can generate maximum profit to look after his family with love.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine spare parts for her husband workshop.

loans.name: Yit's Group

texts.en:
Yit’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yit makes a living cultivating rice and selling fish to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhin's Group

texts.en:
Sokhin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Enos has been working hard to manage his sand business, which deals in sand. 

To help expand his business, Enos has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sand, and will help Enos to generate greater profits and increase sales. Enos hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Enos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sand

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano es un grupo nuevo, formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural alejada de la capital del país, son mujeres unidas y luchadoras que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su grupo.
La Sra. Angela es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, y hasta muy noche, comenta que poco a poco se fue armando su negocio y que hoy ya es muy conocida.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con bebidas, lácteos, verduras, frutas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo sigue haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
San Cayetano is a new group, formed in the city of Curuguaty. It is a rural area, far from the country's capital. They are united and tenacious women who want to improve their quality of life through their group. 
Angela is one of the members. She has her store in which she works every day from early in the morning until late at night. She says that little by little she was putting together her store, and today it is very well known.
She asks for this loan to be able to stock her store with beverages dairy products, vegetables, fruits, and other items. In this way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She expresses her gratitude for the opportunity that all are receiving to be able to continue with their sales.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 38 years, married to Irene and he supports 6 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 6 years and the business earns him KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase packets of maize seeds and sacks of fertilizers for planting in his farm so as to get as to get a better harvest.

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him supply milk to clients in the region and educate his children. 

His hope is to eradicate poverty in his family and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase packets of maize seeds and sacks of fertilizers for planting in his farm so as to get as to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale in the market.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico has been operating  his cafeteria  business for seven  years. And he really earns enough to support his family need. He has been successfully repaid also his previous loan used in business. He was determined enough in sustaining his business. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase of raw ingredients for his new recipe made in order to give the satisfaction of his customers. In the future, he wants to improve the business as well as general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for the new recipe that he is going to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Julie dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelia is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Emelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 56 years old and married with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jearelyn

texts.en:
Jearelyn is 26 years old with two children. Jearelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jearelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries.

Jearelyn has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Jearelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melanie is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melanie has a business buying and selling personal product care items in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, face powder, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap and face powder.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Norma is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell in her coconut wine vending business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Precila works very hard to provide for them.

Precila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Precila has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Precila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is a  married with three school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Thida’s group live in a rural village in Kompogn Thom province in Cambodia. Thida does work as construction worker and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani  is age 48; she is a mother of seven sons and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rani requested a loan for her son so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

She hopes that her son will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Rani thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits for her son's general store.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widowed woman with three children one of them attends school.She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mwanamisi has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. In addition she also operates a cashew-nuts business that earns her another source of income.

With the Kshs 350,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old with three children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marites has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store  for 5 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Marites aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 22 years old and has one child.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like shampoo, groceries, etc..

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 38-year-old lady, living with her spouse and a child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her family members but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving auto rickshaws for many years and his income is barely sufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to fix problems 

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to fix the auto rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan for repairing her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O senhor Francisco de 38 anos de idade é casado, trabalhador, pai de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário e outro ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
O cliente tem uma casa tipo 1 pretende colocar instalação  electrica pelo que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar tubos, bocais, fios, lâmpadas, contador, interruptores, caixas de derivação e pagar o contracto de energia
Tem como sonho concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente abrir um negócio para sua esposa como forma de aumentar a renda familiar
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao trabalho e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Francisco, 38, is married. He works and is the father of two children; one of them goes to secondary school and the other one to primary school. They own the house where they live.

He has a 1-bedroom house and is planning to install electricity, which is why he will use the loan to buy conduits, outlets, wires, lamps, a meter, switches, and junction boxes, and pay for electricity.

He dreams of finishing building his house to offer his family a better home. In the future, he wants to start a business for his wife in order to increase the family’s income.

His main challenges are of a financial nature, but he has been turning to his business and plans to apply for more loans in order to satisfy his needs and fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy conduits, outlets, wires, lamps, a meter, switches, and junction boxes, and pay for electricity.

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
Sherlie is 31 years old and has four children. With three children in school, Sherlie works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy spices, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Sherlie has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Sherlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spices, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is 50 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Sotera works very hard to provide for them.

Sotera runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Sotera has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Sotera would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetics. Teresita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business such as nail polish, a nail cutter, etc. 

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as nail polish and a nail cutter.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wilma is 45 years old and has one child in school.

Wilma has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted vegetables to sell .

Wilma has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry birds and feeds, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve business. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more poultry birds and feeds

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is 18 year old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ana Rose has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Ana Rose requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ana Rose has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ana Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
