Rosalinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 52 years old and has one of her children in school.

Rosalinda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yolanda is 49 years old and one of her children is in school.

Yolanda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ambika Mission Shakti Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sabita, aged 33 years, is an enterprising and hardworking lady from a small village of Jharsuguda district. She is the one standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

Sabita has a small family consisting of her two school-going daughters and her husband, who is a bus driver. Sabita lives a very contended life with the income that she generates from her food stall and her husband's income.

The criticality of the situation is that she does not have a proper toilet in her house. Her toilet is in a very precarious condition and is releasing a very bad smell which is very unhygienic for her living.

Therefore, Sabita, along with her group members, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to renovate her toilet and promote cleanliness and hygiene in her family as well as in her community.

loans.use: to renovate her toilet

loans.name: Chhoun's Group

texts.en:
Chhoun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhoun makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a huge amount of clothes for re-selling

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La señora Basilia y su concubino el señor Francisco viven en una zona rural del Departamento de Cochabamba, ambos solo estudiaron hasta el nivel primario, actualmente cuentan con una hija de 2 años. La cliente se dedica a la elaboración de polleras en la zona donde viven, son personas de escasos recursos ya que ambos se vinieron del campo en busca de mejores días y así poder surgir en la vida y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, la señora requiere un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para así poder hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayor fuentes de ingresos ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos que viven en una zona muy alejada del centro de Cochabamba y también así poder ayudar con la alimentación y vestimenta de su hija la cual es muy chiquita y al estar en constante crecimiento los gastos son aún más frecuentes.
texts.en: Basilia and her life partner Francisco live in a rural area of the Cochabamba department. They both have a primary school education and now they have a 2 year old daughter. She works making skirts in the area where they live. They are people of low income, as both of them come from the country in search of  better days and to get ahead in life and give their daughter a better quality of life. She needs a loan to acquire a larger quantity of raw materials so that she can grow her business and generate more sources of income because they are a low income family that lives in an area that is very far from the center of  Cochabamba. This way, she can also help feed and dress her daughter, who is very small and constantly growing, so the expenses are even more frequent.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabrics) to expand her business and have a better supply for the public and generate better income for her family.

loans.name: Aster

texts.en:
Aster is 33 years old with one child. Aster works very hard to provide for them.

Aster runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy eggs, junk foods, bread, and other groceries.

Aster has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Aster would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, junk foods, bread, and other groceries

Maricel has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Leticia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

As a married parent of three children, Elvie works hard to support her family.

She has a mineral water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Elvie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of mineral water to sell for her mineral water business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of mineral water to sell

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Lubna wants to grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. 

She is the a honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Surriyan

texts.en:
Surriyan is 50-years old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore. Her husband conducts a business in which he sells various colors threads, laces, spools, paper cotton, packs of zippers, sequins, studs etc. He buys from wholesalers on low price and sells in Lahore city. His shop situated in the market among many tailors; the ladies of town use to purchase raw material from his shop for sewing clothing. In this tenure he has built up positive relationship with the tailors.

With the increment in new customers and demand, he wants to buy more raw materials in bulk, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income and ultimately savings as well. 

She praises our honorable support and sends thanks to Kiva and to its field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of various colors threads, laces, spools, paper cotton, packs of zippers, sequins and studs for her husband's stitching materials selling shop.

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
A senhora Inês de 51 anos de idade, solteira, comerciante, mãe de 1 filho que se encontra na responsabilidade do pai, vive em casa própria.
A cliente vende  roupa e com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar fatos, duvetes, cadeiras, mesas, mantas para ampliar o seu negócio.
Tem como sonho ampliar seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes e construir mais dependências para aumentar a renda familiar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar para supri-los pelo que pretende tomar mais vezes o credito de forma a alcançar seus sonhos
texts.en:
Inês, 51, is single and works as a businesswoman. She has a son who is under the care of his father. She owns the house where she lives.

She sells clothes and with the requested amount will buy dresses, duvets, chairs, tables, and blankets to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to fulfill her customers’ needs and build more rooms to rent out and increase the family’s income. Her main challenges are of a financial nature and she has been working to face them. She plans to apply for more loans in order to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy dresses, duvets, chairs, tables and blankets to expand her business.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.pt:
O senhor Jacinto, 58 anos de idade, casado trabalhador, pai de 6 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário e os outros 5 já concluíram o nível médio é responsável por 3 netos vive na casa própria.
O cliente tem uma casa tipo 3 pretende com o valor do empréstimo comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, ferros, para dar continuidade da sua obra.
Tem como sonho concluir sua casa de modo oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente contrair o matrimónio com a sua esposa.
Os principais desafios são financeiros tem recorrido ao trabalho e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Jacinto, 58, is married and works. He is the father of six children; one of them goes to secondary school and the remaining five to middle school. He is responsible for three grandchildren and lives in a house that he owns.

He has a three-bedroom house. With the requested amount, he will buy cement, zinc sheets, and iron bars to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to finish building his house in order to offer his family a better home and be able to formalize his marriage. His main challenges are of a financial nature and he has been working to face them. He is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheets, and iron bars to continue with his construction works.

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
Bernagen is a 52-year-old woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Bernagen has a guitar making business in the Philippines. Bernagen requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed such as wood, thread, etc.

Bernagen has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Bernagen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed such as wood, thread, etc.

loans.name: Genilyn

Genilyn has a dried-fish making business in the Philippines. Genilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to dry.

Genilyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Genilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry

loans.name: Abrella

texts.en:
Abrella signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Abrella was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jelly

Jelly has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta is 59 years old, but she did not lose competitiveness in business. 

Augusta opened her business in 2011 with $600.00. After four years of efforts already running, now she has an idea of requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

With this money Augusta wants to buy more goods such as cooking oils, sugar, salt, sardines, noodles, candles, biscuits, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. 

She is very hopeful that with this loan she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, sugar, salt, sardines, noodles, candles, biscuits, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:

Julieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is married with one child. He manages his own farm to make a living. For four years, he has been planting and harvesting coconut and vegetables. He requested a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to pay for laborers to harvest coconuts in order to increase the output of his farm. Rodolfo wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting coconuts on his farm.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is always traveling to sell her various consumable products that give her an approximate income of PHP 9,000 per month. She needs to help her husband to provide the needs of their family knowing that their eldest child is already in college. 

Fe is 48 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, which is her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures. 

Recently, Fe availed a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of patrons. The amount will be used to purchase additional stocks for her buy & sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her buy & sell business

loans.name: Paul Bryan

texts.en:
Paul Bryan is 48 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over 4 years and earns 10,500 PHP every month. 

He has been with GDMPC since 2014 and is now requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to repair and purchase spare parts. He dreams of helping his children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Mirasol works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mirasol is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like dried fish, junk foods, condiments, home product care and other groceries for her general store business.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, junk foods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Novelinda

As a married parent of four children, Novelinda works hard to support her family.

Novelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Lucia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Luz

Luz has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as softdrinks, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, rice, candies and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

Maria Luisa is 48 years old and married with six children. Maria Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like home product care and other groceries.

Maria Luisa has been in this business for 3 years.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Paula Cristela

texts.es:
Paula, de 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, hijos y sus suegros, es una familia pequeña pero bastante unida.

Paula, toda su vida ha sido agricultora junto a su esposo y es de esa actividad productiva, que les ha permitido criar a sus hijos.

Paula, necesita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, que necesita para sembrar maíz.

Paula, sueña con enviar a sus hijos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Paula, age 43, lives with her husband, her children, and her mother and father-in-law. It is a small but very united family. Paula has been a farmer all of her life with her husband. It is this productive business activity that has allowed them to raise their children.

Paula needs the loan to buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides in order to grow corn.

Paula dreams of sending her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides that she needs to plant corn.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra vive en el trópico de Cochabamba, con sus hijos y su esposo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, trabaja juntamente con la ayuda de su marido en el área agrícola, en su terreno propio lo cual lo adquirieron con mucho sacrificio después de años de trabajo como jornaleros, en dicho terreno cultivan piña, el cual es un cultivo rentable hoy en día, la fruta es su sustento económico, el cual es comercializado a comerciantes de fruta en la misma actividad económica, la señora Sandra pudo ver que la piña es un cultivo rentable y ella tiene el deseo de seguro creciendo económicamente y salir adelante por el bienestar de su hijos por lo cual decidió realizar la ampliación de la plantación, es por ello que la señora requiere un préstamos para poder efectuar lo propuesto. la señora Sandra considera lograr sus objetos propuestos y así seguir generando mas ingresos para su crecimiento económico.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the tropics of Cochabamba with her children and her husband. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She works in agriculture, with the help of her husband. They own a plot of land they bought with a lot of effort after years of hard work as day laborers. In this plot, they grow pineapples, a profitable crop nowadays. They make a living from growing fruits and selling them to businesspeople.

Sandra realized that it was profitable to grow pineapples and would like to continue growing and getting ahead for the sake of her children. This is why she decided to enlarge her plantation. For this, she is requesting a loan. Sandra wants to achieve the goals she has set for herself in order to increase her income and grow.

loans.use: to enlarge her pineapple plantation and increase her sales.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, 55, is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessie has had a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines for four years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy wheels and other spare parts. In the future, Jessie would like to save enough money to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 35 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for them. Maribeth has run a general store in the Philippines for one year. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store (small convenience store). In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos dependientes que estudian en el colegio. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con la familia, produciendo papa y locoto como los principales productos agrícolas de mayor demanda en el mercado. Los ingresos económicos obtienen a través de la producción y venta de papa y locoto que son también el sustento para su alimentación. La señora Albertina requiere el financiamiento para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos. 
Por último, la señora Albertina se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, mejorará e incrementará la producción de papa y locoto y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Albertina lives and works in Colomi. She's married and has three dependent children who attend school.

She works in agriculture with her family, growing potatoes and locoto peppers, the main crops in greatest demand in the market. They earn their income from growing and selling their potatoes and locotos, which also supports their diet.

Albertina needs the loan to buy organic soil amendments (chicken manure), potato seeds, and agrochemical products.

Finally, Albertina is happy about the opportunity to get a loan for her needs. With the purchase of agricultural inputs she'll improve and increase her potato and locoto crops and have more sales to improve her standard of living and her social situation, to her family's benefit.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and seeds to improve production and sales and have a better quality of life

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 55 years old and married with four children. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Rosalina has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, shampoo, soap, eggs, toothpaste coffee, candies and other groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ludma

texts.en:
Ludma is 46 years old, married with six children. All of whom are attending school.

Ludma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ludma has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Ludma aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for six years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jeronimo

texts.es: Don Jerónimo, tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside  con su esposa y un nieto en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijoles y luego comenzó a cultivar café, el cual es su mejor fuente de ingresos. Esta producción de café la vende en su localidad. Don Jerónimo ha obtenido tres prestamos anteriores con la institución para asistir sus cultivos, actualmente solicita otro por 10,500 Lempiras para limpiar y abonar dos manzanas de finca de café, ya que necesitan darle una buena asistencia para mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir aumentando el cultivo de café para obtener ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jerónimo, age 64, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and one grandson in a village in the Nueva Frontera municipality in Santa Barbara. He has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. Later, he started to grow coffee, which is his best source of income. He sells his coffee production in his area.

Jerónimo has gotten three previous loans from the institution in order to care for his crops. He is now requesting another loan for 10,500 lempiras to clear and fertilizer two manzanas of his coffee farm. He needs to give them good care in order to improve the production. His plan is to continue increasing his coffee crop in order to improve his earnings and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on two 'manzanas' [a manzana is approximately 1.73 acres] of coffee and to pay to clear the fields.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en: Bienvinido, 57, is a married man who has run a motorcycle transport for seven years in order to make a living. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy new tires to ensure his safety and better service to his costumers. In the future, Bienvinido wants to buy an additional vehicle to use to expand the business and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mandy

texts.es: La señora Mandy de 26 años de edad, soltera, tienen dos hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, con domicilio en la ciudad de Cochabamba, se dedica a la actividad pecuaria, del cual produce leche, para lo cual cuenta con ganado vacuno propio, a esta actividad se dedica desde hace 6 años, cuenta con la suficiente experiencia para hacer frente a cualquier complicación, para realizar su actividad cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja y sus hijo, además la pareja se dedica a prestar servicios de electricidad domiciliaria (maestro eléctrico), ambas actividades son fuente de sus ingresos, ambos muestran ser personas muy responsables y con muchas ganas de superarse, la señora requiere un préstamo para que le ayude económicamente porque tuvieron gastos inesperados, en la adquisición de herramienta de trabajo de ocasión para la actividad de su pareja, la solicitud  de ayuda económica es para la compra de insumos (cascarilla de soya) para su ganado, que por las condiciones climatológicas, no cuentan con mucho forraje propio, motivo por el cual necesita comprar insumos secos, esto para que no disminuya su producción y disminuya el nivel de sus ingresos, siempre velando su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mandy is 26 years old and single.  She has two children who depend on her financially.  She lives in Cochabamba and makes her living raising livestock for milk production.  She owns her cattle and has run her business for 6 years.  She has sufficient experience to confront any issue, and relies on the help of her partner and their children to carry out the business.  Her partner also works providing home electrical services as a master electrician.  Both jobs provide income.  Both partners are very responsible people who really want to improve their lives.

Mandy seeks a loan to provide economic support, as they had unexpected costs in acquiring a tool for her partner's job.  The loan she requests is for the purchase of supplies (soybean husks) for her cattle, as they have little forage of their own due to climate conditions.  For this reason she needs to buy dry feed to keep production from falling and decreasing her income level, in order to protect the well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies (forage, soybean husks) to feed her cattle, increase her income, and improve the economic condition of her family.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman who has four children. Leah is 47 years old and is residing at Balas, Balingao Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Leah sells seafood products, especially fish, in the local community to earn a living and she has been doing this business for five years. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP with this business.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell.

In 2013, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricris is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maricris has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maricris requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline, fish nets, and other fishing supplies.

Maricris has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maricris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish nets, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Rosalinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Orquidia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (MARIBY YUSEYDI, MARITZA DEL SOCORRO y MARTHA ELENA) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 9 meses para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. El nombre de Orquídia es en representación a la hija de Mariby, coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, que significa “Flor Colombiana”.

MARIBY YUSEYDI: Es una joven sonriente y alegre de 19 años de edad, con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario, madre soltera de una pequeña recién nacida. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, sacar adelante a su pequeña hija y tener un medio para de sustento para sus necesidades básicas, desde hace 1 año estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda que es de tambo y de madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three women (Mariby Yuseydi, Martiza del Socorro y Martha Elena). They belong to the Miskita people and live in the city of Bilwi, located in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are all enterprising women that work every day with the goal of expanding their small businesses. They started this communal bank nine months ago to be able to apply for a loan from Pana Pana. The group’s name, Orquídia, means “Colombian flower” and honors Mariby’s daughter. Mariby is the group’s coordinator.

Mariby Yusaydi is a smiling and joyful young woman. She is 19 years old and has a strong will to get ahead and good skills to be a leader. She is the coordinator of the communal bank and a single mother of a newborn baby girl.

She wanted to generate her own income, provide for her daughter and fulfill her basic needs, so she opened a small grocery store one year ago in her wooden stilt home.

She is requesting this loan to buy cereals and candies, among other products. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy cereals and candies, among other products.

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janelyn is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Janelyn has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Janelyn has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ainnie

texts.en:
Ainnie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ainnie is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ainnie has a general store business in the Philippines. Ainnie requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ainnie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ainnie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es: Jose, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado, tiene con su esposa dos hijos y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la ganadería y hace 10 años que decidió cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Su mayor fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de café, el cual vende en la misma zona. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abono, insecticida y limpieza de la finca de café y poder mejorar su finca y su producción.  tiene como plan seguir ampliando su finca de café y darle buena asistencia para obtener mas ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en: José, 44, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Previously, he was engaged in raising cattle, and ten years ago he decided to grow corn, beans, and coffee.  His main source of income is growing coffee, which he sells in his area. He has requested a loan for 10,000 Lempiras to purchase organic fertilizer, insecticide, and to clean the coffee farm, which will enable him to improve his farm and his production.  His plan is to continue expanding his coffee farm, and provide it with good care in order to obtain more profits and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, insecticide, and to clean the coffee farm

loans.name: Xiêm

texts.en:
Mrs Xiêm is 55 years old and she is married.

She has worked in agriculture, growing industrial crops for four years. Xiêm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in the village. Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipments to build a toilet. This is Xiêm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Although Xiem has a lot of difficulties in life, she always moves forward. Xiêm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dried and to sell.

loans.name: Londresa

texts.en:
Londresa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Londresa is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Londresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Londresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Londresa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Londresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sonia Argentina

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y  vive con su hija mayor en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara, cerca de la Flecha, Santa Barbara. Hace dos años inicio su propio negocio de una pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como arroz, manteca, huevos, churros, frijoles, jabón, condimentos, harina, pan, y otros. Además vende ropa como blusas, camisetas y faldas. Ha solicitado varios préstamos en ODEF, actualmente solicita otro ciclo que es por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir más el negocio con productos básicos como arroz, frijoles, manteca, pan, huevos, productos de aseo, condimentos y otros. Su objetivo es mantener buen inventario para aumentar las ventas. Su meta es tener una tiendita de ropa al lado de su pulpería para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 50, is a single mother, has 3 children and lives with her oldest daughter in a village of the town of San Marcos, Santa Barbara, near La Flecha, Santa Barbara. 

Two years ago she started her own business, a small grocery store, selling food products, like rice, butter, eggs, chips, beans, soap, condiments, flour, bread and others. She also sells clothing, like blouses, shirts and skirts. 

She has requested several loans from ODEF, and she is currently requesting another one for 15,000 Lempiras to supply her business with more basic products like rice, beans, butter, bread, eggs, cleaning products, condiments and others. 

Her objective is to keep a good inventory to increase her sales. Her goal is to have a small clothing store next to her grocery store to improve her incomes.

loans.use: to supply her business with basic products like rice, beans, butter, bread, eggs, cleaning products, condiments and others.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mirasol is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mirasol has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mirasol requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Mirasol has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalina has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 42 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pamela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pamela requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Pamela has been in this business for five years. In the future, Pamela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Đoài

texts.en:
Mr. Đoài is 45 years old and he is married
 
He has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years. Đoài lives in the Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in the village, moreover his job is unstable. His family has a two-hole latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is that the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Đoài's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. Although Đoài has difficulties in life, he always tries to upgrade his standard of living. Đoài hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Edith Yaneth

texts.es: Edith, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, el cual vende en la misma zona y es su fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 12,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con la institución, con este prestamo va comprar abonos y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación y limpieza de su finca de café. Su meta es cultivar más café para ayudar a su familia y vivir mejor.
texts.en: Edith, 41, is married and has two children.  She lives in Gracias, a rural town in Lempira.  She has always made a living from the land and has operated a coffee-planting business for the past 10 years.  The business supports her family and is her only source of income.  She sells what she harvests locally.  Edith is applying for a 12,000-lempiras loan, her fourth round of funding from the bank, that she will use to pay for the labor and supplies she needs for her next planting.  She expects to grow more coffee this year, a result that will help her family to live better.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and supplies she needs for her next planting.

loans.name: Ingrid Mercedes

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Ingrid, tiene 40  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 12  años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante de lotería. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Ingrid es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso un pequeño negocio en su casa, ella realiza una gran variedad de dulces artesanales como los alfajores (dulce típico de los países de América Latina y se caracteriza por tener una forma redondeada y estar relleno de crema dulce), dulce de leche (también conocido como manjar, manjar blanco, confiture de lait, arequipe o cajeta) y que corresponde a una variante caramelizada de la leche., galletas de almidón, huevos moyos y otros dulces. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes por cuatro horas diarias de lunes a viernes, ella misma se encarga de hacer las entregas y recibir los pedidos. Trabaja sola. Tiene cinco años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar harina, leches, azúcar, esencias, etc. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 ciclos y le gusta porque el promotor esta siempre pendiente del grupo.  Su sueño es tener una tienda de venta de dulces típicos y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and visited resort of Ecuador.  With its beautiful and inviting beaches it is the first deep water port of Ecuador and South America.  Ingrid lives here.  She is 40 years old, married, with two children aged 15 and 12, both of whom are in school.  Her husband works in the lottery business.  They live in a home they own.

Ingrid is a very hard working woman.  To help with the family expenses she started a small business in her home.  She makes a wide variety of artisanal sweets, such as alfajores (a typical round cookie in Latin America, filled with sweet cream), dulce de leche which is a form of caramelized milk (also known as manjar, manjar blanco, confiture de lait, arequipe o cajeta), starch biscuits, huevos moyos (a typical sweet wrapped in colorful paper and often served at weddings and quinceañeras), among others. She works every afternoon for four hours, from Monday to Friday.  She makes all the deliveries herself and takes all the orders.  She works alone.  She has worked at this job for five years, and things are going very well.

She will use this loan to buy flour, milk, sugar, extracts, etc.  She has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 8 cycles and likes it because the facilitator is always responsive to the group.  Her dream is to have a shop that sells artisanal sweets, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, extracts, etc.

loans.name: Celeste Asuncion

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Celeste, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante de gallinas criollas y queso. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Celeste con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días dos horas diarias, deja a crédito la mercadería  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene cinco años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de acceder y los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered as the most important, popular and visited beach town in Ecuador, due to its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is also the main deepwater port in Ecuador and South America.

This is where Celeste lives. She is 54 years old, married, and has six children, all of them adults and independent. Her husband sells a local breed of chickens, and cheese. They own the house where they live.

Celeste wants to generate her own income, so she sells all kinds of clothes, door-to-door, but also at home, where she has her little store. She works two hours every day. She sells on credit and collects the money every second week. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every second week or every month, depending on her needs. She has been doing this for five years and is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses and shirts. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and likes to be one because it is easy to apply for loans and the interest rates are low. Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Sreynich

texts.en:
Sreynich is an 18-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Law, and is in her second year at a university in the city. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a farmer. 

Because Sreynich is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

Her dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary and be able to use her qualification, so that she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees in Law, for the second to fourth year

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is a 38-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of four children.
Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of city also. 
He has gotten a new contract for whitewash and oil paint of newly constructed house but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing services.

Farkhanda has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.
His savings is very poor that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil for her husband's whitewash services.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa sells soft drinks to earn an income. She earns an additional income by freezing water and selling ice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She and her husband have eight children, and she works hard to support her family.
 
Ninfa is borrowing PhP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more soft drinks to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive el señor Víctor, tiene 30 años de edad, soltero y vive en casa de sus padres.
Don Víctor para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a sus padres con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar hace ocho años realiza trabajos de belleza a domicilio, realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar esmaltes, tintes y  alicates para manicure  de manos y pies, entre otros. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Su sueño es llegar a tener un SPA.
texts.en:
The city of Manta, the first deep water port of Ecuador and South America, is the most important, most popular, and most visited resort in Ecuador due to its beautiful and welcoming beaches.  

Victor is 30 years old and single, and lives in this city in his parents’ home.  To earn his own income, and thereby help his parents with the cost generated by maintaining their home, Victor established a beauty salon in his home eight years ago.  He offers a variety of services such as hair dying, haircuts, nail painting, and other services.  He works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later if his customers need his services.

He will use this loan to purchase nail polish, hair coloring, and nail clippers for manicures and pedicures, among others.  He had been with the communal bank through five loan cycles, and he enjoys it for the help and benefits that he receives from the communal bank.  His dream is to have a Spa.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, hair coloring, and nail clippers for manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anacorita is 58 years old now.

Anacorita has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Anacorita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, underwear, etc..

Anacorita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Anacorita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelita is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Angelita has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipments for her business such as welding machine, welding rod, etc..

Angelita has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Angelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment's for her business such as welding machine, welding rod, etc.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is 37 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Cherrylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Cherrylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like peanut, junk foods, biscuits, eggs, home product care, etc..

Cherrylyn has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Cherrylyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like peanut, junk foods, biscuits, eggs, home product care, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cresencia is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cresencia has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cresencia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, age 60, buys and sells bananas to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. She and her husband have three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Estrella requested a PhP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more bananas to offer for sale.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Pawanka Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Crisbila, Lea Engracia y Elba Elvira), viven en la comunidad de Betania, que se localiza aproximadamente a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos, y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario PAWANKA, porque en vocablo miskito significa desarrollo y ellas consideran que con el crédito que se les otorgará contribuirá al crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Crisbila: Es una señora miskita, amable, con cualidades de líder, casada. Su esposo se dedica actividades agrícolas. Tiene 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, estableció una pequeña en el corredor de su vivienda que es de tambo y madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para viajar a la Ciudad de Bilwi y comprar productos para su pequeño negocio: Granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, entre otros productos.  Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The three members of the Pawanka community bank, all women, live in Betania, a rural town some 40 kilometers from Bilwi.  The members (Crisbila, Lea Engracia and Elba Elvira) joined together to borrow funds from Pana Pana that they will use to support their small businesses and, in turn, provide for their families.  The members chose the name, Pawanka, because it is a Miskito word for development and they are confident that the loan that they are applying for will contribute to their efforts to grow their businesses and increase their incomes.  

Crisbila is Miskito.  She is a friendly woman and a natural leader.  Her husband is a farmer and the couple has 3 children, the two oldest of whom are in school.  Her youngest child, 2-years old, is still at home.  Crisbila wanted her own income so she started a retail business from a space in her house.  Her earnings go to household expenses and her children's schooling.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with merchandise that she will buy in Bilwi--cereal grains, soft drinks, etc.--for resale.  She hopes to become a successful merchant.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Sivon

texts.en:
Sivon is 21 years old and a third-year Accounting university student. She resides in the Kratie Province in Cambodia. She is a single, works as a cleaner at an institution in a province, since 2014, earning around $5 per day. 

Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees from the third through her fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. 

After graduation, she dreams to have a good job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay her university fees in Accounting from the third to her fourth year

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 50 years old whose primary source of income is through his farming activities. He owns a rice land, corn field and a vegetable farm. He lives with his family at Lawis Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This farming activity supports his family needs especially to the studies of his eldest daughter who is now in college. 

Recently, he asks for PHP 10,000.00 loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling and sowing.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling and sowing

loans.name: Florepe

texts.en:
Florecepe runs a motorcycle transport business to earn an income. She is also a MIGS member of Paglaum MPC, which financed her business when she decided to start it up. She now earns a steady income from her business.

Florecepe lives with her husband and family in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

She would like to increase her monthly income by adding another motorcycle transport unit to her business. She therefore requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which will allow her to pay for labor costs for building a motorized tricycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for building a motorized tricycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell furniture.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional stock frozen foods to sell for her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, coffee, home product care and other groceries.

Lydia has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, coffee, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc..

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco build his home in 2014, with his own working capital and until now his house has been completed, but stayed unpainted, as he did not have the money to buy more materials.

So now he is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to buy more paint and other materials to use. He is very hopeful with this money he could finish his house in a short time.

loans.use: To buy paint his house and other materials to use.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
A senhora Joana, 35 anos de idade, solteira, comerciante, mãe de 3 filhos, dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino secundário e 1 ensino primário, vivem na casa própria.
A cliente tem um negócio de venda de roupa e diversos. Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar fatos, duvetes, capulanas, mantas, cortinas, panos de mesa para reforçar o seu negócio
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Os principais desafios são financeiros mas tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Joana, 35, is single. She is a businesswoman, and the mother of three children. Two of them go to secondary school and one to primary school. They own the house where they live.

She sells clothes and other products. With the requested amount, she plans to buy dresses, duvets, capulanas [a type of a sarong worn in Mozambique], blankets, curtains, and tablecloths to strengthen her business.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to fulfill her customers’ needs. Her main challenges are of a financial nature, but she has been working to face them and is thinking of applying to more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy dresses, duvets, capulanas, blankets, curtains and tablecloths to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo Andres

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive el señor Ricardo,  tiene 20 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene 1 hija de 2 meses. Su esposa es profesora de tutorías. Viven en casa de los suegros.
Don Ricardo aprovecha de sus conocimientos en reparación y mantenimiento de equipos electrónicos y equipos informáticos, infocus, pantallas, audio, plasmas, computadoras portátiles, impresoras, aulas, equipos audiovisuales, etc. El tiene un local en la misma casa donde vive, también tiene repuestos nuevos que utiliza para reemplazar las piezas, esto le gusta hacer y tiene su clientela. El está estudiando en la Universidad  y  trabaja solo.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar repuestos y otros materiales. Está en el grupo de crédito hace dos ciclos, le gusta la fundación porque no hay dificultades para acceder a los créditos y los intereses son bajos.  Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is said to have Ecuador's most popular beaches.  The city also hosts one of Ecuador's and South America's most important deep-water ports.  

Our member, Sr. Ricardo, 20, lives in Manta with his wife and 2-month old daughter.  His wife is a teaching assistant and the family lives with his in-laws.  Don Ricardo has made the most of his knowledge of electronics to start an electronics repair and maintenance business.  He works with projectors, screens, computers, printers and other electronic equipment.  He operates the business from his in-law's house and stocks spare parts that he uses for repairs.  He likes the work and has steady customers.  He also studies at the local university.  

Don Ricardo is applying for a loan that he will use to buy spare parts and other supplies for his business.  He has been a member of his community bank for two rounds of funding and likes it because accessing funds is relatively easy and interest rates are low.  His goal for the future is to buy a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his electronics repair business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos de 7, 9, 15 y 13 años los mismos que estudian en escuela y el colegio también tiene un hijo discapacitado de 22 años y los otros son mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es obrero. Viven en casa propia.
Doña María para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, etc.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando él puede y está desocupado, pero por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar porque a más de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a sus alrededor. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, most popular and most frequented resort in Ecuador, due to its beautiful and idyllic beaches. It is the first deep water port of Ecuador and Latin America.

This is where Ms. Maria lives. She is 40 years old and in a common law marriage with seven children. Those aged 7, 9, 15 and 13 are all studying in school. She also has a son who is 22 years old and disabled. The others are of legal age and independent. Her spouse is a construction worker. They live in their own house.

In order to support herself and her family, Ms. Maria runs a grocery store out of her house. She sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables, fruits etc. She works every day from 8am to 5pm and sometimes later. Her husband helps her with the work whenever he is free, but for the most part it is her who spends the most time in the store. It is the place where she likes to be because apart from earning her living, she entertains herself by learning about the news that happen in the area. She has been working in this business for two years and it is going well.

She will use this loan to stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other basic products. She has been a member of the loan group for two loan cycles and she likes it because she has made friends in the group. Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other basic products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 28 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Oliva

texts.en:
Ma. Oliva is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Oliva is 51 years old.

Ma. Oliva has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Oliva requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Oliva has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Ma. Oliva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
Ma. Rowena is 43 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ma. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Rowena has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Soriya's Group

texts.en:
In her early 30s, Soriya, who is a married mother of two dependent children, under age of school, lives in Kratie province where she is growing cassava as the main business. Working for her co-villager’s farm for a fee has been important to supplement her income. She is able to earn about 40,000KHR. The cassava crops, which she expected to produce more yields, produce low outputs while the crop’s price also declined in market. 

Now, Soriya is leading a group of two members to request for a loan of 1,000,000KHR for each, which is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee, buy organic fertilizer, cassava seeds, and organic pesticide to increase productivity of her crop yields. She hopes she is able to sell her yields in a high price to earn more income in order to upgrade the standard of living and expand the business.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, buy organic fertilizer, cassava seeds, and organic pesticide to increase productivity of her crop yields.

loans.name: Beang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Mondulkiri province, Beang is 48 years old. She is a married woman who blessed with five dependent children, one of whom is in school and needs her support. Growing cassava has been her main business for years. Occasionally she works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee. 

Unfortunately, her cassava crops were destroyed by pests, and she cannot manage to earn good income. This has become her main challenge. As the leader of her group of two members, Beang is applying for a loan to save her cassava farming business. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and the past loan was fully repaid. 

Beang will use her loan to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects. She hopes that she can produce greater yields so as to generate more income to better support the family’s needs and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, age 34, operates a sari-sari (general store) business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for five years, and she earns PhP 5,000 every month. She lives with her husband and their child in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

Juliet is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2013. 

She will use her increased income to better meet the family's daily needs. 

Juliet hopes to see her business progress and expand in the future. Her goal is to support her child's studies through college.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: 6 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE ABRIL” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de chocolates, venta de rellenos, venta de adornos en yeso, venta de frutas, venta de papa frita.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace veintidos años y con un pequeño capital que tenia decide implementar su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el fácil acceso de crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen nueve personas ya que se encuentra también el esposo de la señora Gregoria, quien vino a acompañar a su esposa al desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal association "6 De Abril" (6th of April) will begin its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Villa Adela. It is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Mrs. Vicenta is the president. The business that the members of the communal association run are varied and among them include: blanket sales, chocolate sales, stuffing sales, plaster adornment sales, fruit sales and french fry sales. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro-companies where Mrs. Vicenta is a member. She shares that she has been with Pro Mujer for two years, having entered through a massive promotional invitation held in her area. Currently she has a blanket sales business, she lets us know that she learned this trade from her mother twenty five years ago and with the small capital that she had she decided to start her own business. 

The loan she is taking out will increase her capital allowing her to purchase wool at wholesale prices which she will receive from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and subsequently, the elaboration and commercialization of blankets in her store. This kind of work will allow her to generate income to support her family economically, being married and the mother of two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the easy access to credit and the healthcare area that the institution offers. 

In the photo there are 9 people because included in it is the husband of Mrs. Gregoria who came to accompany his wife at the disbursement.

loans.use: purchase wool at wholesale prices

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is a 22-ear-old woman with a young child who lives in Battambang province. She grows rice  and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

She has farmed for 5 years and does not have enough capital to expand her business. She earns 18,900 KHR per day.  This is her first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she leads a 2-member group. She will manage her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and plowing fees. 

She hopes that she can increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and plowing fees.

loans.name: Merade

texts.en:
Merade is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school.

She has grown  rice for 10 years and  is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income selling charcoal.

She is works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim, age 33, is a farmer. To earn an income to support her family, she grows cassava on four hectares of land and rice on one hectare. She has been involved with her current business for seven years. She also works for others for a fee to earn additional income. 

Nim lives with her family in a rural village in the province of Battambang. She is the mother of three children: one is attending school, and the other two are not yet of school age. 

She currently does not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her farmland, so her cassava is not growing well. She is therefore leading a group of two members to obtain a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds, as well as to pay plowing fees. This will allow her to improve her farmland and produce larger yields.

This is her fourth microloan with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has repaid her past loans reliably. Her past loans enabled her to earn more income, which helped her to improve her family's living conditions and support her child’s education.  

Her goal is to continue to increase her income so that she can upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, as well as to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Marifboi

texts.ru: Марифбой мужчина в возрасте 33 лет проживающий в селе, он женат и имеет 1 ребенка. С юных лет Марифбой занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Эту профессию он перенял от отца, который был фермером в колхозе. Отец многому его научил и этот опыт очень пригодился ему для развития своего бизнеса. Начинал Марифбой всего с двух голов скота и со временем смог увеличить поголовье скота до 8 голов крупного скота. Жена Марифбоя домохозяйка и помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Каждый день она доит коров и продает полученное молоко на колхозном рынке. Животноводство для семьи Марифбоя является основным источником дохода.
