На данный момент из-за понижения цен на скот Марифбой не может продать скот за достойную цену, а ему нужно покупать корм для скота. С этой проблемой Марифбой решил обратиться за помощью в «АРВАНД». На полученные деньги он хочет закупить корм для скота.
texts.en:
Marifboi is a 33-year-old man who lives in a village. He has a wife and a child. Since he was young Marifboi has been engaged in fattening the cattle. He inherited this profession from his father who was a farmer on a collective farm. Marifboi's father taught him a lot, and this experience helped Marifboi a lot to develop his business.
Marifboi started out only with 2 head of livestock and with time he was able to increase the capita to 8 head of livestock. 
Marifboi's wife is a housewife, and she helps her husband to take care of the cattle. She milks the cows every day and sells the milk at the collective farm's market. 
For Marifboi's family livestock breeding is the main source of income. At this moment, due to the decrease in cattle prices Marifboi can't sell his livestock for a decent price. However he needs to buy feed for the cattle. With this problem Marifboi decided to turn to "ARVAND". He will use the money to buy feed for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick is a 35-year-old resident of Gata Diot, Clarin, Mis. Occ. He has raised pigs for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP  monthly. 

He has been a member of GDMPC since 2005, and applied for a loan from GDMPC microfinance of 50,000 PHP to buy feed. Roderick wants to  expand his business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Robles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROBLES” iniciará el séptimo  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Tesorera Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de jugos vitamínicos, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, servicio de orquesta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de orquesta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace cinco años de una amiga quien le ayudo a iniciar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una batería, que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz, esta compra le ayudará a renovar su equipo musical ya que con el que cuenta en la actualidad está muy desgastada y posteriormente ofrecerá sus servicios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROBLES” communal bank is staring their seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional branch, It is made up of eight members, lead by a board of directors with Juana as Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of food, selling vitamin juices, selling clothing, selling blankets, a neighborhood store, perfume sales and an orchestra service.

The loan they are taking will benefit all these micro entrepreneurs, Juana amongst them. She states that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a orchestra service business. She says that she learned this business five years ago from a friend who helped her start the business.

The loan that she is now getting will be used to buy drums which she will acquire at the wholesale vendors of the city of La Paz. This purchase will help her renovate her musical equipment as what she currently has is very worn to later offer her services. This method of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy drums.

loans.name: Las Gigantes De 26 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS GIGANTES DE 26 DE FEBRERO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de bisutería, venta de gelatina y crema de leche, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa para niños, servicio de transporte, venta de perfumes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace un año con la ayuda de una amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de colonias y perfumes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo. 


Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
En la foto no aparece la señora Simona porque después del desembolso tuvo que irse a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
“Las Gigantes de 26 de Febrero” [The Giants of February 26th] Communal Bank will begin their first loan cycle with ProMujer, as part of the Villa Adel Regional Center. The group is comprised of eight members, and managed by a board of directors where Marisol is president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses including the sales of clothing, costume jewelry, gelatin and cream, cosmetics, children’s clothing, and perfume as well as transportation services.  

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Marisol is a member. She says that she is a new member of ProMujer, and was invited to join during a massive promotion the institution conducted in her area. Currently, she has a business selling cosmetics, and says that she started this business a year ago with her friend’s help.

She will use the loan she is taking out now to increase capital (to purchase wholesale cologne and perfume), which she will acquire from wholesalers in El Alto, and later market at her sales stand.  This type of work permits her to generate income to support her family financially as she is unmarried and has a son.

When asked what she liked about ProMujer, she replied that she likes the health benefits and training the institution offers.  
Simona doesn’t appear in the photo because, after making the payment, she had to get to her sales stand.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cologne and perfume.

loans.name: Mariposas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSAS DE ORO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de guantes y gorros de lana, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de guantes y gorros de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madrina hace cuatro años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una máquina de coser que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto, esta adquisición le ayudara en el aumento de capital ya que la señora podrá tejer más guantes de lana para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casad y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Mariposas de Oro" (Golden butterflies) will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center of Panamericana. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Mrs. Elsa is the president. The business the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: wool gloves and hat sales, neighborhood store, perfume sales, clothing sales, sport clothes sales, salchipapa (potatoes and sausage) sales, toy sales and petticoat sales. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro-companies where Mrs. Elsa is a member, she shares that she came to Pro Mujer through a friend's invitation who is a client of the institution. She is currently running a business selling wool gloves and hats. She has it be known that she learned this trade from her godmother four years ago. 

The loan that she is currently taking out will be used to purchase a sewing machine which she will acquire from the stores in the city of El Alto, this acquisition will help her increase her capital as she will be able to knit more gloves than before to eventually sell in her store. This way of work will allow her to generate income to support her family economically, she is married and the mother of four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthcare area and the training the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Pech is the leader of this group of borrowers. He supports his family by working as a farmer. 

The members of Pech’s Group live in a rural village in the province of Battambang. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. They are therefore requesting a loan in order to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, as well as to save money on medical expenses. They will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a 47-year-old married woman with three children (all attend school)  who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Valentina has a fish vending business for 10 years and requests 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish  and  other supplies.

In the future, Valentina would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish  and  other supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has had a home-based  care products business for 10 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy soap.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  soap.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTITAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de helados, venta de cajas para trofeos, venta de queso, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia  es integrante, ella indica que hace que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cajas para trofeos; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de su esposo hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papel trepan por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Las Kantutitas de Chijini" (The Small Kantutas of Chijini) will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center of Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Mrs. Cecilia is the president. The business the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: blanket sales, ice cream sales, trophy display case sales, cheese sales and a neighborhood store. 

The loan the will take out will benefit the small micro-companies where Mrs. Cecilia is a member, she shares that she came into Pro Mujer through a friend's invitation who is a client of the institution. She is currently running a business selling trophy display cases. She has it be known that she learned this trade from her husband several years ago. 

The loan that she is currently taking out will increase her capital allowing her to buy trepan paper at wholesale prices which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and subsequently sell it in the city of El Alto fairs.  This way of work will allow her to generate income to support her family economically, she is married and the mother of one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase trepan paper at wholesale prices

loans.name: Zeina Group

texts.en:
Christiane is the featured borrower for Zeina Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and their lives at the same time.

Christiane is a 48-year-old married mother of two children. Five years ago, she started preparing and selling food from her house in an attempt to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary foodstuff to increase her production and satisfy her customers' needs. She is the second lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Elise is the first lady on the right, Antoinette is the second lady on the right, and Therese is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary foodstuff to increase her production to satisfy her customer's needs.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Жительница города Душанбе, Зухро. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и не имеет детей. Зухро красивая, умная и ответственная женщина. У них не получилось иметь детей. Зухро живет с мужем. Ее муж честный и заботливый человек. Она занимается один видом бизнесом. Зухро любить заниматься торговлей. 18 лет она продвигает свой бизнес. У нее имеется магазин, где продает продукт питания. Зухро мечтала расширить магазин и увеличить товарооборот. Но он не смогла, потому что у нее были проблемы с деньгами. Зухро решила взять кредит и достичь мечты. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Зухро надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Zuhro, a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 47 years old. She is married and has no children. Zuhro is a beautiful, clever and responsible woman. She was not able to have children. Zuhro lives with her husband. Her husband is an honest and caring person. He is engaged in a type of business. Zuhro loves trading. She has been running her business for 18 years. She has a store where she sells produce. Zuhro has dreamed of expanding her store and increasing her stock of goods. But she has not been able to do so, because she has had financial problems. Zuhro has decided to take a loan and achieve her dreams. She believes in you and in your support. Zuhro hopes for your support.

loans.use: to increase her stock of produce for sale.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, age 41, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Florita requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy food items to offer for sale in her store, such as bread, liquor, and snack foods, as well as household items like detergent.

In the future, Florita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food items to offer for sale in her store, such as bread, liquor, and snack foods, as well as household items like detergent

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en:
Terezinha is married, and she is a businesswoman. A loan of $1,000 was offered to Terezinha to improve her business. She has a small kiosk, and she wants to add to her inventory so that she can increase her income. With this money she will buy more goods including biscuits, hand/body lotion, candies, water, coffee, salts, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. 

She hopes to open a big stall, which could happen soon.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, hand/body lotion, candies, water, coffee, salts, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is a 35-year-old woman with two young children, living in Battambang province. 

She has grown cassava  and worked as a laborer to earn extra income for seven years.  She earns about 40,900KHR per day and does not have enough working capital to support her cassava business;  it is  the main challenge for her business. 

This is her first micro loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to receive a new loan. She will spend her  portion to buy seed, organic pesticide, and pay the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy seed, organic pesticide, and pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en: Len’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang  province in Cambodia. Len works as farmer to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Seun's Group

texts.en: Seun’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Seun works as farmer to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses ,and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: Sochea’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sochea works as farmer to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mao works as farmer to support her family. Villagers have no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 46-year-old woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Irene has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fruit to sell.

Irene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Irene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruit to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 55 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Julie works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Julie has been in this business for five years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Julie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Sokha works as farmer to support his family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Suluukan

texts.ru: Сулуукан, 54 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Сулуукан занимается предоставление услуг общественного питания. Ежемесячный доход - около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на инвестирование в ее бизнес за счет увеличения товарооборота. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Suluukan is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. She is calm, even-tempered and hard-working. Suluukan provides catering services. Her monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for investing in her business by increasing her stock. She will invest the proceeds of the loan in the future development of her business.

loans.use: to invest in her cafe business by buying more stock.

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.ru: Садокат молодая девушка в возрасте 27 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Садокат вот уже на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает молодой скот и откормив продает за более высокую цену. Животноводством Садокат начала заниматься после того как вышла замуж. Видя что мужу одному трудно обеспечивать семью она решила купить пару голов крупного скота и откормив пару месяцев продала. На вырученные деньги она купила еще скот и таким образом постепенно смогла увеличить поголовье скота.  Муж Садокат работает строителем на частной стройке и по сезону ездит в Россию на заработки, но тех денег,  что он зарабатывает не хватает для обеспечения всех потребностей семьи.  На данный момент бизнес Садокат является основным источником дохода для их семьи. Сейчас у Садокат возникли некоторые трудности с финансами из-за упадка цены на скот. Она не может продать взрослый скот не потеряв часть прибыли. С данной проблемой она решила обратится в «АРВАНД» за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги Садокат хочет купить корм для скота и скот.
texts.en:
Sadokat is a young 27-year-old woman who lives in a rural location. Sadokat has been rearing animals for the past five years. She buys young cattle and, having fattened them up, sells them for a higher price. Sadokat began rearing animals after she got married. Seeing that it was difficult for her husband to provide for the family on his own, she decided to buy a couple of heads of cattle and then sold them on after having fattened them up for a couple of months. She bought more cattle with the money and thus was able to increase her herd gradually.

Sadokat's husband works in construction on a private construction site and goes to Russia to work seasonally, but the money that he earns is insufficient to provide for all the family's needs. At the present time Sadokat's business is the main source of income for their family. Now Sadokat has some financial problems due to the fall in the price of cattle. She will not be able to sell the mature cattle without losing some of her profit. She has decided to apply to Arvand for financial support with this problem. Sadokat wants to buy some cattle and cattle feed with the money she receives.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Akuwa est une veuve habitant à Adidogomé ayant quatre enfants à charge. Akuwa est une commerçante de charbon de bois qu’elle achète au marché trois fois par mois et le revend à domicile. Avec le souci d’en tirer un maximum de profit  en vue de bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants, Akuwa demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Akuwa, 48 years old, is a widow living in Adidogomé with four dependent children. Akuwa sells charcoal; she buys it at the market three times a months and resells out of her home. With the goal of increasing her revenues and providing for the education of her children, Akuwa is requesting this loan to stock up on bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy 13 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf is a careful son. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1990 and is living in a village with his family. He is a taxi driver. Also he is working ATS provider. He works hard and patience. He likes his activity and wishes to be helpful to his family. 

He is young and active, but he has some problems with his health. In order to get healing and be healthy, he needs money to pay his medical treatment. He appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to pay his treatment at medical clinic. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay his treatment at medical clinic

loans.name: San Jose De Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN JOSE DE YUNGUYO” iniciará el trigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de sandalias, venta de queso, servicio de construcción, venta de papa y chuño, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que hace trece años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sandalias; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña y hace veinte años decidió iniciar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sandalias por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “San José de Yunguyo” Communal Bank will begin their thirtieth loan cycle with ProMujer, as part of the Panamericana Regional Center.  The group is comprised of eight members, and is managed by a board of directors where Flora is president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses including the sales of sandals, cheese, and potatoes and “chuño” [potatoes processed by successive freezing, thawing, and dehydrating] as well as construction services, and a neighborhood store.  

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Flora is a member.  She says that she joined ProMujer thirteen years ago at the invitation of a friend who is one of the institution’s clients.  Currently, she has a business selling sandals, and says that she learned this business from her parents when she was a young child, and twenty years ago, she decided to start this business.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase capital (purchase wholesale sandals), which she will acquire form the wholesale distributers in El Alto,  This type of work permits her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is married and has six children.  When asked what she liked about ProMujer, she replied that she enjoys the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sandals.

loans.name: Cristina Salome

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de leyes.
Ella es inteligente, soñadora, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad pública, ubicada en la zona central, área que acoge a edificios públicos y privados. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Cristina es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño  largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el –aymará que habla en familia, y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan independientemente, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella trabaja en la venta de ropa de bebe. Debido a su anterior trabajo como asistente legal, decidió continuar con sus estudios en el área de leyes, y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 que dura la carrera. Le gusta interpretar lo escrito en los libros para entender lógicamente lo que el texto quiere decir, tiene gusto por la lectura, cuenta con habilidades de compresión y razonamiento ágil, su razonamiento es lógico, “trabajo y estudio para conseguir un título y poder integrarme al campo profesional…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que los horarios no se cruzan con su trabajo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil para iniciar su tesis de grado. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios para trabajar en su rubro, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para iniciar su tesis de grado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para iniciar su tesis de grado y trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 42 year old woman, single with no children who is studying Law.

She is intelligent, a dreamer, optimistic, patient, responsible and very hard-working. She is studying in a public university located in the center of the city an area that accommodates both private and public buildings. It has a cold climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 to 12 degrees Celsius.

Cristina is dark skinned, has brown eyes, black hair down to her shoulders, short and robust. Her native language is Aymará which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for the work she does. She shares her life with her family members who work independently. They live in a house that belongs to the family built of brick and cement with a metal roof, and a wood floor and that has running water, electricity and sewage.

She works selling baby clothing. Due to her previous work as a legal assistant she decided to continue her studies in the field of Law and currently is in her second year of a five year degree. She likes to interpret what is written in the books to understand logically what the text is saying. She enjoys reading and has comprehension abilities and sharp reasoning. Her reasoning is logical. "i work and study to obtain a degree and be able to integrate myself into the professional world...she commented. The advantage of her studies is that her timetable does not interfere with her work. Her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a laptop to start her thesis. Her dream is to finish her studies and work in her field. She wants to buy a laptop to start on her thesis. This is her first loan with the institution in her two years of study.

For these reasons Cristina is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to start her thesis and work in her field.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to start her thesis and work in her field.

loans.name: Abbos

texts.ru: Аббос жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Аббос живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Он с юных лет работает вместе со своим отцом на поле, учился пасти скот. С тех пор он многому научился и сейчас сам занимается таким же делом. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, Аббос занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Аббосу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Аббос хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Аббос очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abbos is a cheerful and hard-working 35-year-old man. He is married and has two children. Abbos and his family live in a small little village. He worked with his father in the fields from a young age, and learned how to graze livestock. Since then he has learned a lot and now he is engaged in such a business himself. In order to have a regular income for food, Abbos runs his own business. He fattens and resells cattle. He receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps Abbos in his work. She sells the milk they get from the cows. Now Abbos wants to increase his number of cattle to expand his business. He has therefore applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy some cattle. Abbos very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lailanie has a buy-and-sell home care product business in the Philippines. Lailanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more laundry soap to sell.

Lailanie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more laundry soap to sell

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Khun is a 62 years old mother of five dependent children. Nowadays, she needs to support on one schoolchild. For her living, she grows cassava as the single main source of her income for 12 years. The main challenge for her business is lack of working capital. 

This is the third cycle for Khun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully paid back her past loans. Her family’s living has improved gradually. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will manage her portion of loan in order to buy fertilizer, plowing farmland and pay for labor fee for her cassava farm to produce good yield. She hopes that she can get more income from her current business to upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plowing farmland and pay for labor fee for her cassava farm to produce good yield

loans.name: Khalijahon

texts.ru: Халичахон молодая жена в возрасте 25 лет. У нее есть маленькие дети в возрасте 4и 3. Халичахон 5 лет назад решила начать зарабатывать и помочь обеспечить семью. Халичахон решила создать свой бизнес, она начала продавать средства гигиены и разную косметику (шампунь, гель, зубная паста, щетка, дезодорант) и другие. Халичахон  вот уже 5 лет своей жизни продвигает данную деятельность. Она знает все тонкости своей работы. Халичахон хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Она собирается увеличить ассортимент товара. Но для совершения данной операции ей не хватает средств. Халичахон надеется на получения кредита. Она хочет создать устойчивый бизнес добиться признания в этой сфере деятельности.
texts.en: Khalijahon is a young 25-year-old married woman. She has small children who are four and three years old. Five years ago, Khalijahon decided to start earning and to help provide for the family. Khalijahon decided to create her own business and she began selling hygiene products and various cosmetics (shampoo, gel, toothpaste, brushes, deodorant) and other items. Khalijahon has already spent five years of her life on running this business. She knows all of the subtleties of her work. Khalijahon wants to expand her business and attract more clients. She is going to increase her range of goods. But she does not have enough funds to complete this operation. Khalijahon hopes to receive a loan. She wants to create a sustainable business and to achieve recognition in this field of activity.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 44 years old and married with 5 children. With one child in school, Nila works very hard to provide for them all.

Nila runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as liquor and home care products, as well as other groceries.

Nila has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as liquor and home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Marilou has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell spices.

Marilou aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Champey's Group

texts.en:
Champey’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Champey works as farmer to support her family. 

In the group's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khimlorn's Group

texts.en:
Khimlorn’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Khimlorn works as a farmer to support her family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her poultry keeping business, which deals in chicken.

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build a new poultry house, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and boost her chicken quality. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to increase inventory.

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: build a new poultry house for her chickens.

loans.name: Regines

texts.en:
Regines is a married mother of 8 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old, and 5 of her children are in school.

Regines has a buy-and-sell quail egg business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more eggs for her business.

Regines has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Абдучаббор воспитанный и добросовестный мужчина в возрасте 38 лет,  проживающий в сельской местности. Абдучаббор  женат и имеет 3 детей.  Абдучаббор работает на поле по сезону  наемным рабочим и получает небольшую зарплату. Основным источником дохода  у Абдучаббора  является откорм и разведение скота. Жена Абдучаббора  домохозяйка, она  активно помогает мужу по хозяйству и присматривает за скотом.  Сам же Абдучаббор  каждый базарный день выводит скот на скотный ранок и продает, а на вырученные деньги покупает молодой скот и откармливает их, чтоб в дальнейшем продать. Абдучаббор не имеет достойного образования  чтоб работать  на соответствующей работе. Как и все жители сельских местностей финансовое положение у Абдучаббора крайне тяжелое. Абдучаббор хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой товарооборот. По словам Абдучаббора он хочет обеспечить свою семью так, чтоб они не знали нужды. Абдучаббор обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой и надеется получить ее. На полученные деньги Абдучаббор хочет закупить несколько голов крупного скота.
texts.en:
Abdujabbor is a well-mannered and an honest 38-year-old man, who lives in the countryside. He is married and has 3 children. Abdujabbor works in a field as a seasonal hired worker and receives small salary. His main source of income is fattening and breeding livestock. 
Abdujabbor's wife is a housewife, and she actively helps her husband with housework. Also, she looks after the livestock. 
Every market day Abdujabbor himself brings cattle to the livestock market, sells it, and uses the money to buy young livestock in order to fatten it and sell it later.    
Abdujabbor doesn't have a decent education to be able to have a respective work. Like all the inhabitants of rural areas Abdujabbor is in a difficult financial situation. Abdujabbor wants to increase the headcount of livestock and expand his trade turnover. He says that he wants to provide for his family, so they never lack anything. 
Abdujabbor turned to "Arvand" for financial help and hopes to receive it. He will use the money to purchase a couple head of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, etc.

Teresa has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, etc.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 36 ans, Ayoko est mère de quatre enfants. Ayoko habite à Adidogome pour exercer ses activités. Propriétaire d’une boutique, Ayoko vend des produits d’alimentations générales et gagne son revenu grâce à cette activité. Pour s’aaprovisionner au marché, Ayoko demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et des cartons de tomates. Ayoko souhaite réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayoko, age 36, is married with four children and she lives in Adidogome where she conducts her business. She owns a store where she sells general grocery products, and this is how she earns a living. 

Ayoko is seeking this loan to buy merchandise at the market. She plans to purchase sacks of rice and cartons of tomatoes. 

She hopes to make a good profit so as to help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of rice and 6 cartons of tomatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

Virginia has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, though she also earns additional income from buying and selling spices.  

Virginia is borrowing 50,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy assorted vegetables to sell at her buy-and-sell business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро уроженка города Турсунзаде. Ей 51 год. Она замужем и замечательная мать троих детей. Зухро простая и добрая женщина. Её муж работает таксистом, но его доход недостаточен, чтобы покрывать все расходы семьи. И поэтому Зухро начала помогать мужу и занялась разведением животных. Для расширения своего бизнеса Зухро хочет купить несколько голов телят. Но, к сожалению,  для этого у неё нет достаточных денег. Зухро очень нуждается в поддержке!
texts.en: Zuhro is a native of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old. She is married and the wonderful mother of three children. Zuhro is a simple and kind woman. Her husband works as a taxi driver, but his income is not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. For this reason, Zuhro began to help her husband and started breeding animals. Zuhro wants to buy a few calves in order to expand her business, but unfortunately she does not have enough money for this. Zuhro really needs support!

loans.use: to buy a few calves.

loans.name: Khasifa

texts.en:
Khasifa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with none of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Khasifa has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells second hand clothes.

To help expand her business, Khasifa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Khasifa to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Khasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her monthly income.

Khasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Khasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is aged 55 years, married to Isabellah and he supports 6 children. He has been a farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his plants to get a better harvest for family use and a surplus for sale in the market. He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to supply milk to clients in the region and educate his children.

His hope is to eradicate poverty in his family and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his plants to get a better harvest for family use and a surplus for sale in the market.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Sonia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a vulcanizing shop.

Susan dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Soedjehoin

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Soedjehoin est une femme mariée vivant à Adidogomé avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Soedjehoin est très dynamique et vend des céréales pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Soedjehoin s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Soedjehoin demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs, du haricot et du sorgho pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Soedjehoin, age 42, is married with five dependent children and she lives in Adidogomé. She is a dynamic reseller of grains who aims to please her customers. Her activity yields a profit that helps to support her family. 

Soedjehoin stocks up twice a month at the market. She is seeking this loan to purchase maize, beans and sorghum to sell and bolster her revenues. 

She wants her children get a good education

loans.use: to buy 620 bowls of maize, 100 bowls of beans and 200 bowls of sorghum.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married mother of 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old.

Virginia has a personal product care business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as face powder, lotion, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 33 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as face powder, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Sokhom works as a farmer to support her family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savoung's Group

texts.en:
Savoung’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Savoung works as a farmer, and he also does extra work as a seller to support his family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudad De Dios se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Maria, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos mayores  de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es chofer. 
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse sus propios recursos para el bien de su familia, ella tiene una fábrica de chifles en su casa, allí se dedica a preparar chifles ya sean de plátano o de maduro, ya son 8 años que tiene su negocio y tienen muchos clientes que le piden sus productos, ella vende en su casa por fundas o tachos, ella también por las mañanas prepara y hornea pan esto no lo hace en gran cantidad pero todo lo que ella prepara lo vende muy rápido al mismo tiempo que vende los chiles. Trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00, de esta forma ellos logran salir adelante a base de trabajo honrado.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos, aceite, fundas y otra máquina para hacer chifles redondos que también le piden sus clientes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más industrializado y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 63 years old, lives here.  She is married, and has seven adult children, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a driver.

Maria is a woman that enjoys working, and so she earns her own income for the good of her family.  She has a “chifles” factory in her home.  There, she engages in preparing “chifles” from green or ripe plantains.  She has been engaged in this business for eight years already, and has many customers that request her products.  She sells them at home by the bag or pail.  In the morning, she also prepares and bakes bread.  She doesn’t make a large quantity, but she quickly sells everything she prepares while selling the “chifles”.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and, in this way, she manages to succeed and make an honest living.

She will use this new loan to purchase plantains, oil, containers, and another machine to make round “chifles”, which her customers also request.  She has been a member of the communal bank since it began, and she is pleased with the assistance that is always given by means of the loans.  Her dream is to have a more industrialized business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, oil, containers, and another machine to make round “chifles.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 61 years old, married and has five children.

Alejandra is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alejandra has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Genila

texts.en:
Genila is a woman with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old.

Genila has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Genila has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Purification is 62 years old.

She has a buy and sell bananas business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell.

Purification has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marjorie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and married with eight children, with one child in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, personal care products and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, Eli est une femme qui habite à Adidogomé. Mère de cinq enfants, Eli travaille dynamiquement pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille. Pour ce fait, Eli vend des casseroles et des sceaux en aluminium à la devanture de sa maison et gagne un bon revenu. Grâce à son bénéfice, Eli s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sceaux et des casseroles. Eli souhaite maximiser son profit et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au résultat tiré.
texts.en:
Eli, age 33, is married with five children and she lives in Adidogomé. She works hard to help her family thrive. To that end, she sells tin pots and pails in front of her house, and she makes good money through this activity. 

Eli stocks up once a month at the market. She is seeking this loan to purchase pots and pails. 

Her goal is to maximize her profits, which would help her to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 13 dozen pails and 15 pots.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ry works as farmer to support his family. 

In the group's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Sothy, 23, lives in a rural village in Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Cambodia. She is single. For the last five years, Sothy has been growing cassava to make a living. To supplement the income, she also works for others for a fee. She manages to earn about 70,000 KHR per day. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her cassava business. 

Sothy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava to pay labor fees

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en:
Savuth is the leader of this group of borrowers. He supports his family by working as a farmer.

The members of Savuth’s Group live in a rural village in the province of Battambang. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. They are therefore requesting a loan in order to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, as well as to save money on medical expenses. They will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda is the leader of this group of borrowers. She supports her family by working as a farmer.

The members of Chenda’s Group live in a rural village in the province of Battambang. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. They are therefore requesting a loan in order to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, as well as to save money on medical expenses. They will also save time previously spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Renaciendo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACIENDO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabet es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de peluches, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabet es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de peluches; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió veinte años aprendiendo por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de peluches por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
En la foto también aparece la esposa del señor Miguel, que es la señora vestida con una chompa de color plomo y buso azul.
texts.en:
The Renaciendo communal bank will start its second loan cycle with ProMujer as part of the Centro Focal Juan Pablo II.  The group is comprised of eight members, and is managed by a board of directors where Elizabet is president. The members are engaged in various businesses including a neighborhood store, a beauty salon, and the sale of plush toys, clothing, blankets, fast food, vegetables, and fruits.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners such as Elizabet. She sells plush toys, a business that she started twenty years ago, learning on her own initiative. Elizabet says that she joined ProMujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. 

She is applying for this loan to increase capital through the purchase of plush toys in bulk, which she will buy from wholesale vendors in El Alto and then sell at her sales stand. This work allows her to support her family financially, as she is a widow and has three children.

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she responds that she enjoys the savings offered by the institution.

The picture above includes Miguel's wife (wearing a gray sweater and blue pants) as well as the group members.

loans.use: to buy plush toys in bulk.

loans.name: Asilamo

texts.ru: 48 летняя женщина Асиламо. Она жительница города Куляб. Асиламо живет вместе мужем и детьми. У нее одна дочка и двое сыновья. Сыновьям 25, 19 и 15 лет. Мужу 51 лет. Муж и старший сын разнорабочий. Вот так они зарабатывают на жизнь. Сама Асиламо дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ.  2 года Асиламо занята своей работой. Ей в работе помогает дочка. Асиламо и ее муж решили отремонтировать дом, и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Для купли стройматериалы и ремонта у них не хватает денежных средств, и Асиламо была вынуждена, обратится за кредитом. Поддержите ее достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Asilamo is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the Kulob city. She is living together with her husband and children. Asilamo has one daughter and two sons.Her children are 25,19, and 15 years old. Her husband is 51. 
Asilamos's husband and her oldest son are general laborers. This way they earn their living. Asilamo herself is engaged in sewing custom made women's clothes at home. Asilamo has been doing this for 2 years now.Her daughter is helping her. 
Asilamo and her husband have decided to repair their house and improve their family's living conditions.They don't have enough money for the construction supplies and for the repairs, so Asilamo had to apply for a loan. Please help her reach her goals.

loans.use: to repair the house and purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He has no children. For the past 2 years, John has been working hard to manage his poultry business, where he rears poultry birds.

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more layers and broilers, and will help John to generate a greater profit. John hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his income.

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more layers and broilers for his poultry business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 49 years old. He is married and has 5 children to support.

He is a farmer, a business he has been in for the last 15 years earning an income of KES 8,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as secateurs for pruning his tea, jembes (hoes) and pangas (machetes) to improve his work efficiency.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as secateurs for pruning his tea,  jembes and pangas to improve his work efficiency.

loans.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudad De Dios se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa local.
Doña Susana es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le gusto valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios ingresos gracias a su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, prepara almuerzos y meriendas en su casa los mismos que luego manda a entregar a una empresa de la localidad la cual le pide sus alimentos, por lo general ella prepara 30 almuerzos diarios esto lo realiza de lunes a viernes mientras que los fines de semana vende meriendas en su casa, lleva 2 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos, lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella, sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
“El Grupo De Credito Ciudad De Dios meets every two weeks in the district of La Victoria 2 in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its gorgeous beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Senora Susana lives in this city.  She is 35 years old, married, and they have three children who are 13, 11 and 6 years of age.  The children are all in school.  Her husband works in a local company.

Susana is a very determined woman who has always enjoyed working for herself and, thanks to her work, obtaining her own income.  She has a business selling food. She prepares lunches and snacks in her house that get delivered to a local company that has requested them.  In general, she prepares 30 lunches a day.  She does this from Monday to Friday, while on the weekends she sells snacks from her house.  She has been doing this for 2 years and it gives her good earnings.

This loan is to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies to prepare the food.  She has had 3 cycles with “El Grupo De Credito” and she likes it because the loans are of great help to her.  Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en:
Chhean’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. He is the leader of this three-member group and works as a farmer to support his family.

In Chhean’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. To this end, Chhean has applied for a 624,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner iDE Cambodia to buy each member of the group a ceramic water filter. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

In Pha’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. To this end, Pha has applied for a 936,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner iDE Cambodia to buy each member of the group a ceramic water filter. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province, in Cambodia. Sinuon works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a village coordinator to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 46 years old and married with two children, both in school. Adelaida works very hard to provide for her family.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries .

Adelaida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, conditioner, snack foods, coffee, biscuits, and lotion. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Alicia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase coconut wine to sell.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Baptista

texts.pt:
O senhor Baptista de 30 anos de idade é comerciante, casado, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar,vive na casa própria.
Com o empréstimo anterior comprou mercadoria para a sua mercearia e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar omo, arroz, biscoitos, bolachas, sabão, velas, mayo, danone, pipocas, jigas, mentas, doces, massas, para reforçar o seu negocio
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as mesmas e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Baptista is a 30-year-old merchant. He is married and the father of three children, two of which go to primary school and one is still not of school age. He lives in his own house.

With the previous loan he bought merchandise for his corner store. With the current loan he intends to buy Omo powder detergent, rice, cookies, bar detergent, candles, Mayo products, Danone products, popcorn, bait, mints, candies and pastas to improve his business.

His dream is to finish construction work, furnish, and expand his business to meet his customers' needs.

He has financial challenges. He has been working and intends to take more loans to overcome these and reach his objectives.

loans.use: to buy Omo powder detergent, rice, cookies, bar detergent, candles, Mayo products, Danone products, popcorn, bait, mints, candies and pastas.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, age 55 and widowed, runs a general store business to earn her living. She has been running the store for four years, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. She has eleven children, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Isabel requested a PhP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and home care products. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Isabel's goal is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to offer for sale in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and home care products

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Margaret Lourdes makes and sells slippers to earn her living. She earns an additional income by running a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She and her husband have two children, and she works hard to support her family.

Margaret Lourdes is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 9000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional materials like rubber and straps for her slipper manufacturing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like rubber and straps for her slipper manufacturing business

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eladia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Eladia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Eladia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eladia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 43 years old and married with three children.

Gladys works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Gladys has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Gladys aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokneang

texts.en:
Sokneang is originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. Sokneang is 28 years old and a widowed mother of one pre-school child. For more than 10 years, she has been farming rice and working as a tailor at home to make a living. She can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sokneang has never been with VisionFund before. She is now going to apply for a loan to buy more fabric for her tailoring business and also to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her farmland as well as her tailoring business to gain more income for supporting her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her tailoring business and also to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old with one child in school. Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.
