Letecia has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, coffee, toiletries, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Kashinath

texts.en:
Kashinath, age 43, hails from the small village of Salepur, Odisha, India. Being a differently-abled man has never stopped him from succeeding in his life. His strong determination and willpower have helped him to establish his business and earn his livelihood. He is the only breadwinner in his family and works really hard to earn his livelihood. He owns a bicycle repair shop and has 10 years of experience in this activity. He also works as a part-time mason after accomplishing his work in his cycle repair shop.

Kashinath is requesting a loan of 24,000 INR. He will use the loan to renovate his cycle repairing workshop as it has been deteriorating due to a lack of maintenance in the past years and a small part of the loan will be used to purchase spare parts for repairing the cycles.

Kashinath dreams of building his own house where he can live with his family happily, expand his business and someday open a car repair workshop. He is in dire need of your help.

loans.use: to renovate his cycle repair workshop and purchase spare parts for repairing the cycles.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
A windowed mother of one dependent child, aged 38 years old, lives in Battambang province. Nowadays, Ly grows cassava as her single main source of income to improve her living condition. She has involved her business for 10 years and she can save her daily income about 37,900KHR per day. Lacking of working capital of operating her cassava is the main challenge. 

For Ly, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support her cassava to produce more yields. She hopes that her cassava can gain higher yields with good income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support her cassava to produce more yields

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her clothing retail business.

Grace dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michelle is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Michelle has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is 26 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Mary Lou works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Lou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Mary Lou has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Mary Lou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kimeng's Group

texts.en:
Aged 24 years, Kimeng is single and lives in a rural area located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She earns a living through growing cassava, which she had been doing for five years. To earn extra income, she also sells grocery items in her village. She can earn about KHR 80,000 per day from the current business and she is able to save about KHR 40,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Kimeng with VisionFund Cambodia. She forms a group of two to seek a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

Kimeng, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to extend her farmland, so as to increase her cassava production, to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 40 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. To support her big family, she and her husband have been working as farmers who have been growing rice and cassava for 22 years. The low price of her cassava is the main challenge for her farm.

Simorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles already. She fully repaid the past loans, which have helped her to improve her standard of living. Now, she is asking for a new loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income, make a better living and keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Phy is 31 years old and married. She has one kid who is too young for school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. Having been in this business for thirteen years, she can earn about 48,000KHR per day and manage to save about 28,000KHR each day after the expenses. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops. 

This is the her first cycle for Phy with KIVA's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income to better off her living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
The lady featured in the photograph is Pramila who has a snack store that she opened after great sacrifice and effort. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small town in Cuttack district, Odisha, India. Her business allows her to work every day, starting in the early morning hours. It has given her the means to help her family. Being a differently-abled person, Pramila is extremely self-sacrificing, yet she always demonstrates her enthusiasm and her ability to move forward. And this is the only reason that her business is running very well so far.

She is requesting a loan of 35,000 INR in order to restock her business with a wide variety of products for her store such as beverages, baked goods, fried potatoes, banana chips, and a variety of sweets, etc. This will help her in attracting more numbers of customers and increase her cash flow. She is pleased with the opportunity she has received so that she can make progress.

loans.use: to restock her business with a wide variety of products for her store such as beverages, baked goods, fried potatoes, banana chips, and a variety of sweets.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran, aged 33, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard to keep her children smiling.
Her husband is a low earner; as she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. 

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 
KIRAN is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her stationary business.

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, reams of paper, pencils and pens. It will help Pauline to generate greater profits. Pauline hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another stationary store.

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pauline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy books, reams of paper, pens and pencils

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Ysabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudad De Dios se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 7 años de edad, la menor  estudia en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta colaborar con su esposo y así con su ayuda el pueda llevar el pan diario a su hogar, ella le da el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio,  el se  dedica al comercio, vende pescado para lo cual todos los días se desplaza hasta Playita Mía lugar en el cual muchos comerciantes como el se dedican a la venta de mariscos, allí el compra el pescado a pescadores de la zona luego en el mismo lugar el vende a otros comerciantes que los levan a otras ciudades donde venden el pescado al público, en ocasiones el fleta un carro y entrega a fabricas de la ciudad donde ya desde hace tiempo el entrega, lleva 8 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ayudar a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un carro para que el venda.
texts.en:
“El Grupo De Credito” meets every two weeks in the district of La Victoria 2 in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its gorgeous beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Senora Maria lives in this city.  She is 39 years old, married, and they have 3 children who are 21, 18 and 7 years of age.  The youngest one is in school.  Her husband is a businessman.

Maria is a woman who enjoys collaborating with her husband so that, with her help, he can earn the daily bread for their home.  She is asking for the loan for him to use in his business.  He sells fish. Everyday he goes to Playita Mia, a place with many businessmen like him that work selling shellfish.  There, he buys fish from the fishermen of the area which he then sells to other businessmen who take it to other cities where they sell fish to the public.  Sometimes,  he loads a car and delivers to a factory in the city where he has delivered for many years.  He has spent 8 years working in this way, which provides the necessities of life.

This loan is to buy fish.  It is the beginning with “El Grupo De Credito” and she likes it because the loans allow her to help her husband.  Her dream is to have a car for selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta is 24 years old and her business is selling vegetables. Every day she is always busy with her business, because she goes to places where people plant vegetables to buy vegetables from them, and after that she brings them to the market for resale. So she is very happy with the business. She has been involved in this business activity since 2013, with her own working capital. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 36 years old and married with five children. With all of her children in school, Rubilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rubilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rubilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rubilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is 47 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Cate has been working hard to manage her poultry business.

To help expand her business, Cate has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to renovating the poultry house, and will help Cate to generate greater profits and meet her family's needs. Cate hopes that in the future she will be able to become a well known supplier.

Cate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of recycled materials business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Aileen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials for her business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Renaliza

texts.en:
Renaliza is 35 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Renaliza has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Renaliza has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Renaliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 44-year-old, married woman with nine children, five are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to dry and sell. Thelma has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Agaton

texts.en:
Agaton is 53 years old, married and has seven children, one is in school.

Agaton is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. Agaton has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Agaton would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 25 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmela has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Carmela has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lav's Group

texts.en:
Lav is a farmer and a mother of seven children, four of whom are dependent on her and only one is in school. In her late 40s, Lav lives in Mondulkiri province where she has been growing cassava as the main source of income for years. In addition, she is working on her co-villager’s farm for a fee to supplement her income. The cassava farming was in danger as the plants were destroyed by pests, which caused her to earn less income than before.

This will be Lav’s third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past two loans were paid back completely and enabled her to improve her living condition. As the leader of a group that consists of three members, Lav will use her loan to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects. She hopes the crop can grow fast and produce more crop yields so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Victoria tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. Having a good harvest and saving enough, she ventures into snack vending at the nearby school. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Victoria borrowed another amount to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. This will help give her farming income a big boost.

Victoria looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a businesswoman in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Esterlita runs a retail store selling consumable products. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. Esterlita believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She tried her luck at doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Daylinda borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. She is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 34 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her clothing business.

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and expand the clothing business. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jessica Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudad De Dios se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su marido trabaja en una fábrica local.
Doña Jessica con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y así ayudarse y ayudar a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi  todos los días a realizar sus recorridos, no tiene horario fijos para salir aunque prefiere salir  en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que ella les da muchas facilidades de pagos a sus clientes, ya son 3 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatillas, camisas, pantalones, ropa de niños y otros productos que vende. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor  a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "Ciudad de Dios" loan group meets every fortnight in the La Victoria 2 barrio of La Manta city, known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited throughout the year, and for being a city of unbeatable beauty with many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 24-year-old Jessica lives. She is married and has one five-year-old son who is attending school. Jessica's husband works at a local factory.

In order to earn her own income and allow her to help her husband with household costs, Jessica works selling all types of clothes and shoes. She sells door-to-door, going out almost every day to make sales. She has no fixed timetable but prefers to go out in the morning when it is easier to make sales runs. Jessica has very good sales as she offers customers many ways to pay for products. Jessica has had this business for three years. It allows her to help her husband, who does not earn much at his work.

This loan will be used to buy trainers, blouses, trousers, children's clothing and other products that Jessica sells. Jessica has been with the loan group for three years and likes it because the loans allow her to stock up her business. Jessica's dream is to give her son the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy trainers, blouses, trousers, children's clothing and more.

loans.name: Andromeda

texts.en:
Andromeda is 36 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Andromeda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Andromeda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 37-year-old, married woman with five children, four who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cherry has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. Cherry has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 58 years old, widowed with two children. Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely has a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Fely has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 25 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edelyn requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. Edelyn has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Raynalyn

texts.en:
Raynalyn is 34 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child in school. Raynalyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Raynalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Raynalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Joy has a vase making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and other supplies like paint, etc.

Mary Joy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and other supplies like paint, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Cada una quiere dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Marciela es integrante de este comité, es muy guapa y activa.  Ella prepara higiénicamente deliciosas comidas y las exhibe en su casilla a orillas de la calle, comenta que tiene buena clientela ya que siempre tiene todo tipo de alimentos y gusta mucho.
Maricela pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group was organized in the city of  Santaní.  They are hard-working women, strongly supporting each other and wanting to improve their living standards and those of their loved ones.  Each woman wants to give her family everything that they were not able to have in the past.

 Maricela is a member of this group; she is a very attractive and happy woman.   She prepares delicious meals hygenically and displays them in her small house beside the street.  Maricela says she has good customers because she always has every kind of food and the customers are very pleased.    Maricela is asking for this loan in order to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, etc., to continue with the sales she has been making and thus keep helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Norfe

texts.en:
Norfe has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Pugwan, Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Norfe knows that she has to get things right to yield more income from this cropping season. 

In the future, Norfe hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is married to a farmer. She learns the craft of farming from land preparation up to post-harvest management/operation. She's making good profit from this activity. 

To increase her income, Procesa cultivates the land after harvest operations and prepares it for inter-cropping season. She plants watermelon, peanut or monggo beans depending on the marketability of the product. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticides for rice production.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticides for rice production

loans.name: Bahromjoni

texts.ru: Бахромчони 24 летный молодой парень.  Он живет в районе Муминабад.  Бахромчони учится в университете, и параллельно  занимается животноводством у себя дома. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Ему на работе помогает его жена. Бахромчони женат, и пока не имеет детей. Он идет по  стопам отца.  Бахромчони обратился за кредитом, потому что у него остался малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота Бахромчони  необходимо определенная сумма денег. Он намерен на заемные средства приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en:
Bahromjoni is a young 24-year-old guy. He lives in the Muminobod region. Bahromjoni is studying at the university, and at the same time he is engaged in cattle breeding at home. Cattle breeding is his primary occupation, as the income from this business provides for the family. 
Bahromjoni's wife helps him with his work. Bahromjoni is married but he doesn't have any children yet.
Bahromjoni is following into his father's footsteps. 
He is asking for a loan because he has a little amount of livestock left, and in order to preserve his business and increase the headcount of his livestock, Bahrmjoni needs a certain amount of money. With the loan Bahromjoni plans to buy livestock and keep his business afloat.

loans.use: to increase the headcount of livestock and preserve the business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 74 years old, a widow who lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has a sari-sari store (convenience store) just outside her house. Despite local competitors and fact that her store is located near a public market, she's still making good sales. She is grateful to Paglaum MPC, her financing partner, that she's able to survive the odds of running a business.

Currently, she asks for a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her store with consumable items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable items.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single woman with one child. She describes herself to be God fearing.

Lilian operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of being a member. He is 79 years old and married with adult-age children.

Hilario is busy in running his farming operations, which are supported by the coop. He said he's secure financially, knowing he can always turn to the cooperative, but he wants to be prepared also for unprecedented life events so he also avails the life insurance of the coop.

Now that his one year life insurance has expired, he borrowed an amount to pay for life insurance premiums.

Hilario believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held at risk for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for life insurance premiums

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold is 33 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Gold has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Gold requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Mary Gold has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Gold would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 31 years old, married and the mother of two sons. Her husband is a government employee.  She has started a clothing sales business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profit from her home to the ladies in her community. 
She needs to purchase more clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of finances, she is unable to.  For that reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Kouméalou

texts.fr: Koumealou est une femme mariée et âgée de 39 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Mère de cinq enfants, Koumealou travaille activement pour leur épanouissement. Pour trouver son revenu, Koumealou vend des friperies dans tout son quartier et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Koumealou demande ce crédit pour commander des habits et des maillots qu’elle pourra vendre et maximiser son revenu afin de subvenir favorablement aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koumealou is a 39-year old married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She has five children and works very hard to ensure their well-being. To make a living, Koumelaou sells used clothing in her neighborhood, stocking up twice a month. 

Koumealou is requesting this credit to buy clothing and underwear for sale, so as to increase her revenues and provide for her children’s everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear for resale.

loans.name: Nhuch's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kratie province, Nhuch is 56 years old. She is married and has ten children; two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She has been growing soybeans for the main source of income for 38 years, and she is also growing cashews to supplement her income. Scarcity of water and declining prices are the challenges to her cassava farming business, which causes her to earn less income than expected.

Due to a lack of working capital, Nhuch is now leading a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for her.

As the group leader, she will spend her loan to pay for the plowing fee, purchasing seeds, organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to grow her crops well. She hopes to increase her yields to earn more income, improve her living standards and to expand the business.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, purchasing seeds, organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to grow her crops well.

loans.name: Zeferina

texts.en:
Zeferina was married. She has a kiosk, so she had the idea to request a loan from the Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She wants to expand her kiosk into a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use this loan to buy salt, cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, sardines, noodles, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She started her business in 2013, with her own working capital. She is taking this loan because she wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, sardines, noodles, candies, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 29-year-old man from Deir Al-Balah City, in the Gaza Strip. It is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He is married and lives with his wife in a small house. Ibrahim works in the public sector where he gets a low income.
He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur. His business idea is to sell cosmetics and accessories for ladies. Ibrahim took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics and accessories to start his own business. He hopes that by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's financial condition. Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Ciudad De Dios se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su marido se dedica a la pesca
Doña Lourdes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse lo suyo para sacar adelante a su familia, ella en sociedad con un hermano se dedican a la venta de alimentos, ellos tienen una carreta en la cual  todas las tardes y noches vende  choclos asados, chuzos y alitas de pollos asadas, acompañadas de colas o aguas al gusto de sus clientes,  lleva más de 2 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo en bienestar de su hogar.  
Este crédito es para comprar carne, choclos, colas, aguas y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella cada vez mejora mas su vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hijo
texts.en:
“El Grupo De Credito” meets every two weeks in the district of La Victoria 2 in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its gorgeous beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Senora Lourdes lives in this city.  She is 24 years old, married and they have a 5-year-old child who is in school.  Her husband works fishing.

Lourdes is a woman who likes to work and to earn her own money to help support the family. Together with her brother, she works selling food.  They have a cart from which every afternoon and evening she sells roasted corn on the cob, skewers, and roasted chicken wings, accompanied by soft drinks or water, whatever their customers prefer.  She has spent more than 2 years in this business which allows her to earn something for the benefit of her home.

This loan is to buy meat, corn on the cob, soft drinks, water and other supplies to prepare the food. She has been with “El Grupo De Credito” from the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she can continue to improve her life.  Her dream is to give the best to her child.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn on the cob, soft drinks, water and other supplies

loans.name: Guadencia

texts.en:
Guadencia is 58 years old, married and has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Guadencia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Guadencia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Guadencia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Guadencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Maritha's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell.

Her business goal is to have more business branches within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, who is in her late 50s, is married with five grown children. She has been running a poultry business for 10 years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to improve her business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to cover household expenses and loan repayment and to reinvest in business.

She will use this loan to improve her business through buying more broilers (poultry). She dreams of making her business grow.
 
Paulina will make sure she repays her loans within the loan schedule time.

loans.use: to improve her business through buying more broilers

loans.name: Espeditor

texts.en:
Espeditor is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a farm where she does horticultural farming. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is changes in weather.

This is Espeditor's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

She hopes that in the future she will be a supplier of farm products to supermarkets.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat 2 C

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Sae (pictured right), works on his 2 acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar. Similar to many farmers in this area, his savings are running low before the harvest season. Proximity's loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before the harvest.

Sae is 57 years old and married with seven children. All of his children are either working or studying. He wants to expand his crop farm, boost his income, and buy his own farming machines.

Pictured above are some of the members from Hta Ni Pat Village Group 2 C, named Sae, Aye, Ohn, Naw and Thi. A CBO leader oversees the group, and the fund will help each member purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

Hta Ni Pat Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Myanmar. Most families focus on crop farming and raising livestock. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and crop seeds.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia, age 31, is a married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her whole family is dependent upon her husband as the sole source of income. 
He owns a workshop where he provides services to troubleshoot and assemble the bodies of auto rickshaws. He fixes the engines, removes the dents over the rickshaw’s body and paints the bodies. Mostly, he paints whole bodies of rickshaws to renew them.
His repairing tools have been wearing out over time so he wants new tools. He does not have enough money to buy these tools to continue his services. Rabia has already spent savings for the maintenance of his workshop.
Therefore, Rabia has requested a loan for her husband to buy new tools and some additional spare parts.
She thanks Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this favor.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her husband's rickshaw repairing workshop.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en:
Nazma is a responsible mother of three daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last five years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Nazma's husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi vehicle because its current condition is not good. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the required maintenance on his vehicle.

Therefore, Nazma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's taxi car

loans.name: Levy

texts.en: Levy learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Poblacion, Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Levy ventures in direct selling to increase her income. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Levy wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Hằng is 35 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
She has a general store selling cake, sweet, suger, milk,... for three years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk,... to resell.
In 2013, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hằng has repaid successfully three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
She is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk,... to resell

loans.name: Sumaia

texts.en: Sumaia is a 23-year-old, single lady from Dier Al-Balah, which is located in the Gaza Strip. Her father works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family needs, but Sumaia wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. As a result, Sumaia took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Sumaia will be able to decrease the electricity expenses while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Sumaia’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Sumaia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Baldomero

texts.en: Baldomero learned about PMPC and the financial assistance it gives startups. As a farmer in Dumingag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jumpstart his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Baldomero feels he owes his good fortune to PMPC for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticides. Baldomero wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Magdalina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc., for her food-vending business. She has been in this business for three years now.

Magdalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc., for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman and 58 years old. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, chicken and spices.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken and spices

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Myrna has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evghenia

texts.en:
Evghenia is a 22-year-old farmer from Stolniceni village, Ungheni region in Moldova. She is married. Evghenia is the mother of a 5-month-old girl. Her husband, Victor, works as a constructor of fridges in other regions in Moldova. On weekends he helps Evghenia in managing their farm.

Evghenia raises sunflowers and corn at a two-hectare land and raises cows, pigs and ducks.
She wants to develop her farm by expanding the plots for cereals, and cereal feed for the animals that she owns.

Evghenia will use the loan to buy land to expand the growing of cereals.

loans.use: to buy land to expand surface of cereals

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses trois enfants. Ablavi travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ablavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des légumes dans son quartier afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Ablavi achète ses provisions sur un marché local et demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine et des bassines de gombo afin de maximiser ainsi son revenu pour permettre l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ablavi is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her three children. She is actively working to support her children's well-being. In order to reach her goals, Ablavi sells food products and vegetables in her neighborhood to make a profit. She purchases her supplies in a local market and is seeking this loan to order bowls of flour and bowls of okra in order to maximize her income and enable her children to thrive.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bowls of cassava flour and 10 bowls of okra.

loans.name: Pindoty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Pindoty” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní, se encuentran en el 7mo ciclo con 17 integrantes. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Sra. Jorgelina es integrante de este comité, es muy emprendedora, trabaja en su propia despensa, y comenta que con su negocio ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, es una mujer muy luchadora que tiene ansias de poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que quiere capacitarse y es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, panificados, bebidas, y otros, de manera a poder tener una buena variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called "Pindoty" was formed by various neighbours in the city of Santaní and they are in their 7th loan cycle with 17 members.  All of the communal bank members undertake independent activities. The members formed a strongly united group which is capable of carrying out joint activities that strengthen their partnership.

Jorgelina is a very enterprising member of this communal bank and works in her own food store. She says that her business helps her family and loved ones. She is a very strong woman who has the desire to develop and succeed.  She says that she wants to improve herself and it is for this reason that she puts every effort into making something of her life.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies for her food store such as vegetables, meats, baked goods, and drinks. She wants to be able to have a wide variety of products to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, and drinks.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 55 years old, married with two children of adult age and lives in Poblacion, Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a corn grower and has cultivated their own land for 20 years to date. She is supported with her husband who is a pedicab driver in their place. Helen has managed her membership with Paglaum MPC and it's evident that she has no default payments on her loan. Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and farm supplies for her vegetable-farming business. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from making furniture.

Helen successfully paid back her previous loan, and she has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and farm supplies for her vegetable-farming business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 75 years old, widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more items, like snack food, canned goods, and other personal care products.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like snack food, canned goods, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 40 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Noshi's Group

texts.en:
Noshi is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 
Noshi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. Noshi hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 
Noshi dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of various colors and designs for her husband's cloth selling shop.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 80 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with four children now at their adult age.

Federico earns a living from his monthly pension and support from his children. He earns an approximate amount of PHP 3,700 per month. He has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for CR repair.

Federico has been a member of PMPC for four years. At present, he is enjoying the products and services of Paglaum MPC, particularly for savings and insurance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 29 years old and married with four children of school age. She has been engaged in farming for two years together with her husband. She found farming promising because it sufficiently provides for their needs, especially for the needs of her children who are all studying. To prepare for the future of her children, she decided to increased her rice production so she is asking for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC. Roselyn is availing herself of a PHP 15,000 loan to pay for seedlings and compost to ensure she will have a good harvest.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Christie

texts.en: Christie is 39 years old, married with school-aged children, and lives in Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her wish is to send her children to school until they finish college and land a good job. She doesn't want to see her children doing back-breaking work in tilling and cultivating land like what she's doing to provide for their needs. Christie is a hard-working farmer and a loving mother to her children. To get a head start for the next cropping season, she requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Juan, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, el está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede sacar adelante su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. 
Don Juan es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante y así irse forjando un mejor porvenir para cuando le toque forma su familia, el se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatos. El viaja a Perú a comprar mercadería a muy buen precio y en diseños modernos y juveniles que es lo que más salida tiene y le dejan muy buenos ingresos,  el vende puerta a puerta, por lo general siempre le ayuda una hermana gemela que es la que siempre le acompaña a vender. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y otras prendas. Sus sueños es tener un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The Corazones Abiertos [Open Hearts] credit group gathers every 15 days in the neighborhood of El Porvenir 2, in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round and for being a city with an unparalleled beauty that has many tourist attractions.

It is here where Mr. Juan lives. He is 21 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents. He has been in the credit group from the very beginning and he likes it because thanks to the loans he can take out he has been able to pull his business ahead, which has permitted him to make a living.

Don Juan is a hard-working young man who enjoys getting ahead on the basis of effort, and so create a better future for when it is time to start his own family. He works in retail, selling clothes of all kinds as well as shoes. He travels to Peru to buy merchandise at good prices and in modern and juvenile designs, as these are the ones that sell the most and leave him with good earnings. He sells door to door, often helped by his twin sister who goes out with him to sell. He has been working in this business for over 4 years.

He will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other articles of clothing. His dream is to have a car he can use to go out to sell.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is a businesswoman who earns through rice production. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house repair. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en: Retailing helped Janelyn survive for the family. She sells charcoal and brings a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needs to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Janelyn plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail. Janelyn smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is a 31-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rocel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rocel requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rocel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Rocel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mery Bertalina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mery, tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad, dos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Mery es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar se dedica  al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos Avon y Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 25 años dedicada a esta actividad razón por lo cual ya cuanta con mucha clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos  perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y todo lo que ella vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los crédito le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su  familia.
texts.en:
The credit group Corazones Abiertos meet every fortnight in the El Porvenir 2 district of the city of Manta, a city well known for its beautiful beaches which are popular throughout the year, and for being a uniquely beautiful city with many tourist attractions.

This is where Mery lives, she is 56 and has a partner with whom she has three adult children. Two of her children still live at home. Her spouse is a master builder.

Mery is a housewife who works in order to obtain her own income and help her spouse with the household costs. She sells all types of clothing and shoes, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, jewelry etc.). She sells door to door, as well as from her home, where her customers come when they need a certain product. She sells on credit and makes collections every week. She has been doing this for over 25 years, which is why she now has many customers.

This loan will be to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, jewelry and everything that she sells. She has been a part of the credit group since the beginning, which she likes as the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, jewelry etc.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a 78-year-old widower from Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is a pensioner member of  Paglaum MPC where he had accessed various loan products that he greatly enjoys. Recently, he would like to avail of a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su marido  con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella  sale tres veces por semana aunque también vende en su casa si alguno de sus clientes necesita de alguna prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y se entretiene ya que le encanta el comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazones Abiertos meets every 15 days in the El Porvenir 2 neighborhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year and for being a city with incomparable beauty that has many tourist attractions.

This is where Martha lives. She is 32 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has two children of 13 and 4 years of age from this relationship. Both are studying in school and in nursery school. Her husband is a carpenter. Martha is a very hard working woman who makes a living selling clothing of all types in order to obtain her own resources and be able to help her husband with the household expenses. Her selling style is door to door. She works three times per week even though she also sells in her home if one of her customers is in need of an item of clothing. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. For 3 years she has done this work with which she earns her own money and is entertained because she loves business.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been with the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dream is to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en: Purification is 73 years old, married and lives in Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) together with her husband. She is also a good member of Paglaum MPC that financed her needs in relation to her business ventures. Recently, she has requested a loan to purchase more stock like noodles, canned goods, dried fish, vinegar, cooking oil, soft drinks, mineral water, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like noodles, canned goods, dried fish, vinegar, cooking oil, soft drinks, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 32 ans, Ama est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants. Dans son quartier, Ama vend des charbons de bois pour réaliser un revenu et répondre efficacement aux besoins, Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Ama demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ama is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her four children. In her neighborhood, Ama sells charcoal to earn a living and effectively meet her needs. She gets her supplies twice a month from her suppliers. Ama is requesting this loan in order to purchase sacks of charcoal and to increase her income in order to help her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase 11 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en: Arcadia is 54 years old, married and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is engaged in a fishing operation and fish selling business. She's doing well in her business ventures, which enables her to provide for her family. Arcadia also grew her membership with Paglaum MPC where she enjoys the perks of being part of the group. She asks for a loan this time to purchase fishing nets and pay for the labor cost in motorized boat repair.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and pay for the labor costs in motorized boat repair

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Edem est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Edem est une marchande de casseroles et de bassines qui s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois et le revend sous un hangar près de son domicile. Edem nécessite ce crédit pour commander des casseroles, des bassines et sceaux en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et prendre bien soins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Edem is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells saucepans and bowls that she gets from the market twice a month and sells from a stall near her home. Edem needs this loan to purchase saucepans, bowls, and buckets in order to earn a profit to meet her day-to-day needs and take good care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sets of three saucepans each, 14 sets of three bowls each, and 23 sets of three buckets each.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking businesswoman from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been into dried fish selling for more than 15 years, and that gives her an approximate monthly income of 10,000 PHP that enables her to support her family needs. She is able to support the education of her 7 adult children. Sarah is supported financially by Paglaum MPC, and that makes her business survive the odds. Now that she wants to expand her business, she ask for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional supplies of dried fish for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Dolores Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos  se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Dolores es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, pollo, carnes, granos, embutidos, así como también artículos de bazar y papelería y muchos otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local a compra los víveres para el consumo diario, sus hijos le ayuda cuando ellos pueden aunque siempre es ella que está en su local, lleva más de 2 años con este negocio el cual le deja muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda y comprar víveres. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The credit group Corazones Abiertos meet every fortnight in the El Porvenir 2 district of the city of Manta, a city well known for its beautiful beaches which are popular throughout the year, and for being a uniquely beautiful city with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Dolores lives, she is 47 and has a partner with whom she has three children adult children. Two of her children still live at home. Her spouse is a cabinet maker. 

Dolores is a woman who likes to take care or herself, by making her own income to get ahead along with her family. She has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells all types of food, chicken, meat, grains, sausages, along with stationary products and many other items to satisfy the needs of the customers who visit her store for their daily needs. 

Her children help her when they can, although she is always at the store. She has been doing this work for more than two years which has given her many benefits. She will use this loan to stock her store and buy food. 

This is her second loan cycle with the credit group, which she likes because with the loans she can keep growing her business.

Her dream is to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Al Ameen Group

texts.en:
Hasnaa is the featured borrower for Al Ameen Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and way of living at the same time.

Hasnaa is a 53-year-old widowed mother of two. Twenty years ago, she started baking Saj bread and embroidering beautiful items to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her businesses. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary ingredients and items for her Saj bread (oil, wheat flour, gas, etc.) and she wants to buy tools for her embroidery business (needles, scissors, hoops and frames, etc.). Hasnaa is the first lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Nisrine is the lady standing in the middle, and Layla is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and other items for her Saj bread (oil, wheat flour, gas, etc.) and to buy tools for her embroidery business (needles, scissors, hoops. frames, etc.).

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita is 58 years old and married.  She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is known in the area because of her delicious and palatable "bibingka" (baked rice cake). 

She has local and passerby costumers who drop by her store to taste her "bibingka". Due to her growing number of costumers, she needs to increase her production.  So, she has asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC. 

Lordita is grateful to the cooperative because she's able to supply the growing demands for her products. Recently, she asked for another loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase ingredients for making "bibingka" (baked rice cake) and for repairs and maintenance of her oven.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making "bibingka" (baked rice cake) and for repairs and maintenance of her oven.

loans.name: María Anabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita  Maria, tiene 23 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia en una universidad en Manta. 
Doña María es una joven que le gusta trabajar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).
