Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los días ya que le encanta salir a vender, también vende en su casa y en el lugar donde estudia ya que sus compañeras son sus mejores clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 2 años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo para sus gastos de estudios que son muchos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Lleva más de 1 año en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños ser  profesional.
texts.en:
The 'Corazones Abiertos' [Open Hearts] credit group meets every fortnight in the district of El Porvenir II in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with visitors throughout the year, for its incomparable beauty and for having many tourist attractions. 

This is where Maria lives. She is 23, is single and lives in her parents' house. She studies at a university in Manta. 

Maria likes to work and makes a living selling clothing, shoes and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door and works every day because she loves to go out and sell. She also sells products in her house and in the place where she studies as her classmates are her best customers. She sells on credit and her customers pay every 8 days. She has been doing this for over two years and it allows her to earn something to put towards the cost of her education, which is very high. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewellery and cosmetics. She has been with this credit group for over a year and she likes it because the loans improve her business. Her dream is to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, costume jewellery and cosmetics

loans.name: Genny Mariela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 24 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Genny  le gusta hacer lo posible por colaborar con los gastos del hogar y mas con los gastos de estudios de su hijo que son muchos y su marido no puede solventarlos, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, ella viaja hasta Huaquillas a comprar mercadería  a buen precio lo cual le deja mejores ganancias, lleva más 3 años en este negocio el cual le deja muy buenas ganancias por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Corazones Abiertos [Open Hearts] credit group gathers every 15 days in the neighborhood of El Porvenir 2, in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round and for being a city of unparalleled beauty that has many tourist attractions.

It is here where Mrs. Genny, who is 24 years old, lives. She lives in common-law marriage, and from this relationship she has 2 children aged 4 and 2. The older one goes to kindergarten. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Doña Genny likes to do whatever she can to help with the household expenses and likes even more to help with her son's tuition, which is a lot and which her husband cannot afford by himself. She works in retail, selling all types of clothing. She sells door to door, going out 3 or 4 days a week to offer her products, which she allows to be paid for in installments. She collects payments every 8 days. She travels all the way to Huaquillas to buy merchandise at a good price, which leaves her with better earnings. Genny has been working in this business for over 3 years, and it has provided her with good earnings which she uses for her family's benefit.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, and other garments she sells. This is her second loan cycle with the credit group and she likes it because the loans are quick and very helpful. Her dream is to be able to give her little ones the very best.

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, and other garments she sells.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 31 years old and married with two children.  Hazel works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Hazel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Hazel aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for 23 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Yit's Group

texts.en:
Yit is a 32-year-old farmer and a married mother blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province, where she has been growing cassava and rice-paddy as her main source of income for 10 years.

She sometimes spends her free time on working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Unfortunately, the crop was destroyed by pests, which caused the crop to produce a lower output than she expected. 

This will be Yit’s fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She paid back her past loans completely. Based on the past loan, she has improved the living condition of her family and she could earn about 36,000 KHR per day to support her family.

As the leader of a group comprising two members, Yit will spend her entire loan portion on seeds and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well. She hopes to gain more yields and earn more income so that she can upgrade the living standard for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Philomena's Group

texts.en:
Philomena is a 37-year-old mother of three. She lives with her husband, who is a teacher. Philomena is a very hardworking woman who processes palm oil and cracks palm kernels. Her first loan from the Cooperative last year helped her so much. Philomena used it to be able to store more palm products and she used the income from her loan to offset her financial responsibility for her family, especially for paying school fees for her children.

Philomena is an active Cooperative member and a loan group leader. She will use her portion of the group's 250,000 NGN loan to purchase and store palm kernel products. Philomena will be able to store palm oil and palm kernels this season to increase her income. Her group thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: help a member to process and store palm kernel products.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mayra es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo a punta de trabajo honrado y con sus ganancias ayudar a su marido con los gastos que hay en el hogar y la crianza de sus hijos, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en el cual se dedica a la venta  de frutas y legumbres, ella todos los días en la madrugada se va hasta dicho mercado a recibir lo que los comerciantes mayoristas le dejan para luego poner a la venta el mejor producto para sus clientes que a diario van a este centro de abastos a surtirse de productos para el diario vivir, ya son más de 7 años que lleva con esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de  su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Corazones Abiertos [Open Hearts] credit group meets every 15 days in the El Porvenir 2 neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Mayra lives in this place. She is 23 years old and maintains a common law relationship. They have three children from this relationship of 8,6 and 2 years of age. The eldest two are in school. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Mayra is a woman who likes to earn her own way through honest work. With her earnings she helps her husband with the costs from their household and from raising their children. She has a shop in the Tarqui marketplace from which she sells fruits and vegetables. At dawn everyday she goes all the way to said marketplace to receive what the wholesale merchants leave her. She then puts the best produce on sale for her customers who come to this supply center each day to stock up on everyday products. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years which is how she earns her own, for the good of her family. 

This loan is for buying fruits and vegetables. She has been with the credit group for 3 cycles and likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 35-year-old hardworking married man with two children ages five and two years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, and he supplements his income with rentals and food selling. This helps him to earn income and sustain his family by buying food, health care and, above all, paying school fees for his children.

 His cash flow needs have slightly risen, as he desires to expand his business and get into wholesale trade. However, he complains of high rental fees and inadequate capital. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy more bread and Blue Band products to sell

loans.use: to buy more bread and Blue Band products to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 28 years old and both children are in school.

Jonalyn has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 42, is a bread-winner of a single-parent family. She is a widowed mother of three children, one of whom is in school and depending on her. 

For 13 years, Sokheng has been working hard to grow rice as the main source of the family’s income. Additionally, she is growing vegetables to supplement her income. Since the crop was flooded, she could not earn sufficient income to support her family’s needs. 

Lack of working capital leads her to apply for a loan from VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and it will be the first loan cycle for her. Sokheng will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to enhance the crop yields. 

She hopes to get more crop yields, to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to enhance her crop yields.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
REHANA is a 43-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he wants to offer seasonal fruits as well, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy new inventory for offering to his customers.

His children are growing, and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in costs of school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his fruit business, but he does not have enough savings to buy seasonal fruits in bulk.

Therefore, REHANA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal fruits to offer.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Margarita Del Consuelo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene  54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es empleado público
Doña Matrgarita es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar, ella hace poco arrendo un local que lo está arreglando para vender flores y arreglos florales, ella espera utilizar este crédito y comprar todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio y empezar a vender sus arreglos, el local está bien ubicado por lo cual asegura que sus ventas serán muy buenas.
Este crédito es para comprar flores, canastas, tarjetas, cintas y muchas otras cosas para realizar los arreglos flores. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido construir su casa con los otros créditos que recibió del grupo. Sus sueños son que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
The credit group "Corazones Abiertos" meets every 15 days in the El Porvenir 2 neighborhood, in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches visited all year round and for being a beautiful city with many touristic attractions. This is where Margarita lives. She is a 54-year old woman who is married and has 3 adult children, 2 of whom live with them. Her husband is a public employee. 

Margarita likes to contribute to the household expenses and recently started to rent a space that she will use to sell flowers and floral decoration. She expects to use the loan to buy everything she might need for the business and to start selling her products. The store is well located and she anticipates good sales. 

She will use the loan to buy flowers, baskets, ribbon and other items. She has been a member of the group since the start and likes to be part of it because thanks to the loans she has been able to build her house. Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy flowers, baskets, cards, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina was appraised as an individual client from Kibibi, aged 51 years and married with one child. She operates a retail shop at Kibibi trading center and besides that she has a mobile money service in the same place.

She has hopes to expand her business. Therefore she’s looking forward to acquiring a loan of UGX2,000,000(two million) to add to her supplies of daily household-use items, such as cooking fat, corn flour, rice, sugar, toiletries, and beverages. These are among other items that are frequently bought by her customers. This loan will help her to meet their needs as well as enable her to make more profit.

She is a hardworking and innovative woman. She is grateful for the Kiva support and partnership and looks towards enjoying more partnerships.

loans.use: to boost her retail store by buying more items for trade.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three sons and one daughter. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore Imtiaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Imtiaz is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
ALLAH RAKHI is a 49-year-old lady, who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years, and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have become less available over time. 

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, ALLAH RAKHI has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

ALLAH RAKHI is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services providing newly constructed houses.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 7 años y un bebé de 11 meses el menor, los tres mayores estudia en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es mensajero en una empresa privada.
Doña Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora que al ver las grandes necesidades en su hogar opto por dedicarse al comercio ya así poder ayudar en algo con los gastos, ella trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad pero también  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a vender en sus días libres y también vende en su lugar de trabajo a sus compañeras, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 8 años en esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante,. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas entre otros. Lleva dos ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y se ayudan entre sí. Sus sueños que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazones Abiertos meets biweekly in the El Porvenir 2 neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which get many visitors year round. It is a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.

This is where Ana lives. She is 36 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has four children from this relationship. The older kids are ages seventeen, fifteen, and eleven, and they all attend school. The youngest child is an eleven-month-old baby. Her husband works as a messenger for a private company.

Ana is a very hard worker, and seeing her family in need she decided to start working in retail in order to be able to help out with their expenses. She also has a job at a local factory, but on her days off she goes out selling clothing, shoes, and Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's accessories). Her coworkers also buy products from her at work. She delivers on credit and collects payments weekly. She has been in business for over eight years, and it helps her make ends meet.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, fragrances, costume jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and other products. She has been with her communal bank for two cycles and enjoys it because it is a very close group and all the members help each other. Her dream is for her children to have a career.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, fragrances, costume jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда гостеприимная женщина, которая всегда встречает людей с радостью и улыбкой. Ей 51 год. Её муж, как и другие жители, находится на заработках в России.  Мавлюда работает портнихой уже много лет. Шитьём она увлекалась ещё в школьные годы. На уроках труда, всегда любила вышивать и придумывать разнообразные узоры, чем и отличалась от своих сверстниц.  Владея всеми тонкостями швейного мастерства, Мавлюда быстро проявила своё умение, и её работа пошла на славу. В данный момент Мавлюде нужно провести свадьбу сына, однако у нее нет достаточно денег. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку и обещает, оплатит кредит за счет швейной работы.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is a hospitable woman who always meets people with joy and a smile. She is 51 years old. Her husband, like with other residents, works in Russia. 

Mavlyuda has been working as a tailor for many years. She has been interested in sewing since her school-going years. During shop classes in school, she always loved embroidering and coming up with a variety of patterns, which differentiated her from her peers. Mastering all the intricacies of the tailoring profession, Mavlyuda quickly showed her abilities, and her work went fantastically. 

Currently, Mavlyuda needs to hold her son's wedding, however she has not enough money. She hopes for your support, and promises to repay the loan through her sewing work.

loans.use: to hold her son's wedding.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.pt:
A senhora Octávia de 50 anos de idade é  agente de serviço numa instituição  de ensino secundário mãe solteira de 2 filhos já maiores não sustenta mais ninguém além de seus filhos e vive na casa própria 
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, varões para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, mobilar fazer dependências para arrendar como forma de reforçar o seu negócio actualmente tem uma a arrendar.
Diz que com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiu arranjar um espaço onde actualmente fez a sua casa e adquiriu bens e diz ainda que tudo o que tem foi graças a ajuda que vem recebendo da Hluvuku e agradece pelo facto. E irá solicitar mais empréstimos para concretiza seu sonho.
texts.en:
Octavia is 50 years old and is a service agent in a secondary education institution. She is a single mother of two older children and she doesn't support anyone else besides her children. She lives on her own house. 

She said that with this loan she will buy cement, stone, sand, and rods to continue the construction of her house.  She currently has one room for rent. Her dream is to finish the construction, to furnish and make rooms to rent as a way to increase her business. She says that with her previous loans she purchased goods and managed to get a space where she has now made her home. 

She also says that she has nothing but thanks for the help that she has received from Hluvuku and she is thankful for this. She will request more loans to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, sand, and rods.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат очень благодарно за Вашу поддержку. Она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Латофат  в протяжение 3 года продвигает свою любимую работу. У нее уже количество клиентов возрастают. Латофат   обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет закончить ремонт. Она не смогла отремонтировать все комнату. Комната, которая осталось без ремонта,  фотографирован с Латофат.  Латофат хочет получить кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать остальную комнату. На счет заемных средств Латофат намерена приобрести строй материалы. Она не смогла копить денег для завершения ремонта. Латофат очень расстроилась, признав, что ее денег не хватит для завершения ремонта и для нее единственный выход получения кредита.
texts.en:
Latofat is very thankful for your support. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Latofat has been persevering onwards with her favourite work for the past three years. The number of clients she has is increasing. 

Latofat has applied for a loan because she wants to finish repairs. She was not able to repair all the rooms. The room which has not been repaired is pictured with Latofat. Latofat wants to receive a loan and use it to repair the remaining room. With the borrowed funds, Latofat intends to obtain building materials. 

She was unable to save money for completing repairs. Latofat was very upset to know that she did not have enough money to complete repairs, and for her the only solution is to receive a loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Verónica Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 40 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos de 23, 17, 15 y 11 años  de edad, los tres menores aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. 
Doña Verónica es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y mucho mas después de la muerte de su marido, ellos tenían un local en el mercado de Tarqui, allí  se dedica a la venta  de frutas y legumbres, ella todos los días en la madrugada se va a dicho mercado a surtirse de los productos para luego poner a la venta,  son más de 20 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual compartía con su marido y que hoy le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazones Abiertos meets biweekly in the El Porvenir 2 neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which get many visitors all year round. Its a beautiful city with plenty of tourist attractions.

This is where Verónica lives. She is forty years old and is a widow. Her husband passed away a few years ago, but she has four children from that relationship. Her oldest is 23 years old and is in college, and the three youngest, who are ages seventeen, fifteen, and eleven, still live with her and attend high school and primary school respectively.

Verónica has had to work very hard in order to provide for her children, particularly after her husband's passing. They both used to run the store she still has in the market of Tarqui, where she sells fruits and vegetables. She goes to the market every day in the very early morning to stock up on products in order to sell them later. She has been in business for over twenty years and it has allowed her to provide for her family.

She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She has been with her communal bank for three cycles and enjoys it because the loans help her a lot. Her goal is to provide for her children as best she can.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 40 pieces of sheet metal and 10 bags of cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Salvacion has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Salvacion has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 58 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sonia has a general store in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell. Sonia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bylykyz

texts.ru: Былыкыз, 49 лет, замужем. Уже 23 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством, продает молоко. В хозяйстве Былыкыз есть 20 овец, 2 коровы, 4 лошади. На 1,0 Га арендованного земельного надела она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Былыкыз на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Былыкыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Bylykyz is 49 years old and married. She has been engaged in animal and field husbandry for 23 years, and sells milk. On her farm, Bylykyz has twenty sheep, two cows, and four horses. On 1.0 hectares of rented land, she cultivates beans for sale. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Bylykyz has a profit of about 20,000 som (KGS) a month. 

With the aim of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 105,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows. Bylykyz plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase the number of her livestock.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 32 years old, married, and has seven children, five of whom are in school. She is in the business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. She has been in this business for a year, and she has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela, 40, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carmela has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell. Carmela has been in this business for two years. In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosie has a purified water-retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of purified water to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel, 31, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Razel has a business buying and selling appliances in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more used appliances to resell. Razel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Razel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used appliances for resale.

loans.name: Azimkan

texts.ru: Азимкан, 61 год, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1985 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Азимкан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 8 овец, лошадь, продает экологически-чистое молоко. Также у нее есть 3,80 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой выращивает картофель, фасоль, клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль Азимкан составляет 13,900 сом (KGS). Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Азимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит накопить на завершение строительства ее дома.
texts.en:
Azimkan is 61 years old, married, and her children are adults and independent. She has secondary-vocational education, and she is engaged in animal and field husbandry to bring income in for her family, having started in 1985. 

Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Azimkan has two cows, eight sheep, a horse, and sells organic milk. She also owns 3.80 hectares of land, on which she cultivates potatoes, beans, and clover. Azimkan's monthly profit is 13,900 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding. Azimkan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, which will allow her to save for the completion of her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 30 years old and the mother of two sons, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is receiving a loan for her husband’s business. His practice is to sell and purchase vehicles' tires. He also provides services to align the wheels of various vehicles. Through this business, he is generating income for his family and cherishing his young children and sibling.

Rehana's husband wants to buy more vehicles’ tires to grow his business, so he can provide all living facilities to his family members, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy more tires. Therefore, Rehana contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and presented her humble request for a loan. 

Rehana seems very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: to buy vehicles' tires for her husband's tire-selling shop.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en: Shaheen is 40 years old, a married woman, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years, to earn money to meet the family's expenses, but now his rickshaw needs proper maintenance to keep it running. For this reason, Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and replace the body of his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Shaheen gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to provide funds to her husband to buy new tires and a new body for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 23 Décembre 2014. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants (02 garçons et 04 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente de sucre et thé. Elle s’approvisionne dans la sous région pour le revendre dans son village en détails.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de sucre à 25000f le sac et du thé d’un montant de 10000f et le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de s’occuper de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was established on December 23, 2014. It is made up of women who are determined to change their living conditions. They all live in the same village and maintain solid relationships of support and interpersonal assistance. Their primary sources of income are small businesses.

Mrs. Aissatou (standing on the right with her hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of 6 children (2 boys and 4 girls.) She is busy with sugar and tea sales. She purchases supplies in the subregion in order to resell them in retail in her village.

With this loan, she intends to buy 2 bags of sugar at 25,000 francs apiece and 10,000 francs of tea and to resell it in retail.

The profit will allow her to take care of her children and help her husband with the management of daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar at 25,000 francs apiece and 10000 francs worth of tea to resell in retail.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “La Esperanza 3” forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres unidas que se ayudan las unas a las otras, es por ello que participan siempre de manera muy activa con las actividades del grupo.
Nilza es una de las integrantes de este grupo, comenta que tiene una peluquería en la que día a día trabaja, poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocida, y ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre van a usar los servicios que ella da. Ella está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio  sus clientes. Ella quiere comprar shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas, y otros.
texts.en:
The group called "La Esperanza 3" is part of a poverty alleviation program. Its members are women who help each other and who actively take part in the group activities. Nilza is one of its members and runs a beauty salon where she works every day. She has become popular and has a good client base. She fights to grow and to get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy items for her business so that she can keep offering a good service to her clients. She wants to buy shampoo, conditioner, dye, lotion and others.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, dye, lotion and others.

loans.name: Emme

texts.en:
Emme is a married woman with three children. She is 34 years old and resides in Lapasan,Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Emme owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business. 

Emme requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase liquor, sardines, etc. to sell. Recently, Emme joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). In the future, she wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase liquor, sardines, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fátima está en su ciclo número 4to  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas  hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y están luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida e la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es una mujer luchadora que quiere ayudar a sus seres queridos, es por ello que esta poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer en el negocio que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, frutas, panificados, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Fátima" is in its 4th cycle of the women committee program, where all women take part in the poverty alleviation program and fight to improve their life conditions. Mirna is one of its members and runs a grocery store. She works every day and starts very early in the morning. She is hardworking and wants to help her loved ones, which is why she is making great effort to grow the business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, bread products and others, so that she can maintain her current sales. She is grateful for the opportunity she has to keep growing and to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruit, bread products and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken.

loans.name: Zhumabek

texts.ru: Жумабек, 35 лет, женат, 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Жумабек имеет в хозяйстве 7 коров, 4 лошади. На земельном участке мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает клевер, вся деятельность приносит прибыль в сумме до 12,000 сом (KGS). Жумабек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей для разведения. Доходы от кредита Жумабек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Zhumabek is 35, married, and the father of three children.  As a way to provide an income for his family, he is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Thanks to his very hard work, he has come to the point where he now has seven cows and four horses.  He also grows clover on three hectares of land and he makes a total of up to 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  He has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy a few horses to raise.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further grow his business and renovate his barn.

loans.use: to buy horses in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи уже много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Айгул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 18,600 сом (KGS). Айгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота для откорма. Айгул намерена накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en: Aigul is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She has a vocational high school education, and for many years has raised animals to provide her family's primary source of income. Thanks to her perseverance, drive, and diligence, Aigul today owns five cows and twenty sheep, and has a monthly income of 18,600 som (KGS). Aigul contacted Bai-Tushum bank for a 80,000 som (KGS) loan to buy animals for fattening. She is determined to save up money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to expand her herd

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a woman who is very interested in business; she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible in the household.

So now she is requests a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as sugar, salts, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She plans to open a bigger business in the future. She opened her business in 2010 with a capital base of $500.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, cooking oils, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, candles, soaps, soy sauce, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last many years. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore Nabeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Nabeela is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman. She has eight children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her primary customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of goods.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Raziya

texts.ru: Разия, 29 лет, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 7 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду, Разия на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от бизнеса 16,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Разия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и сена в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Raziya is 29 and the mother of three children. She has a college education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income and which she started seven years ago. At the moment, she has two cows on her farm. Thanks to her very hard work, Raziya has come to the point where she currently makes a monthly income of 16,800 som (KGS) from her farming business.

Eager to further grow her business, Raziya has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows as well as some hay to feed her cattle. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her farming business.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying two cows and hay as cattle feed.

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан, 64 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и 3 дочери. Она очень честная, трудолюбивая. У Райкан - высшее образование, сейчас на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2000 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Райкан есть 20 овец. Также оказывает швейные услуги на дому, в летний сезон продает арбузы и мороженное. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Райкан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец и покупку строительных материалов для сооружения времянки и сарая. Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Raikan is 64 years old, married, and has three sons and three daughters. She is extremely honest and hardworking. Raikan has a college education and is now retired. She raises animals to earn income for her family. She began her business in the year 2000 and worked to advance it. Currently she owns 20 sheep. She also provides sewing services from her home, and in the summer sells watermelon and ice cream. Today her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She came to Bai-Tushum Bank for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to buy five sheep and construction materials for a temporary shed and barn. Raikan plans to invest earnings from use of the loan into further developing her business. She also wants to do home repairs.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and construction materials for a temporary shed and barn.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en: Sokna, 37, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She has five dependent children, three of whom are in school and the others are too young to attend school. For her living, she has grown rice to support her family condition for more than five years. Her crop having been threatened by drought and destroyed by pests, which are the main challenges for her, her business cannot earn her a good income as before. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she repaid her past loan successfully. Her previous loan helped her to earn a good income to improve her living conditions.In a group of two, she is the leader. Meanwhile, she is going to take a new loan of 1,000,000KHR, and another member seeks 1,200,000KHR. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her rice farming. She hopes that she can upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 46 years old. She is mother of four sons and three daughters and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a General Store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his General Store also. He speaks with steady tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relations with his customers.

His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Kalsoom gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc for her husband's general store

loans.name: Phillipsonne

texts.fr:
Vololona vit toujours seule avec ses 2 enfants dans la ville d’Antsirabe et exerce une activité de commerce de produits de première nécessité. Elle est très contente, c’est son deuxième prêt chez KIVA et son 15ème  prêt chez Vahatra.
Pour ce prêt, elle compte acheter encore plus de produits de première nécessité tels que du riz et du sucre afin d’étoffer son stock. En effet, grâce à plusieurs prêts successifs, elle est devenue parmi les grossistes de la ville. 
Avec les bénéfices des prêts précédents, Vololona a rendu plus confortable sa maison et a acheté 2 porcs pour être engraisser et vendre au boucher. Elle a aussi acheté un terrain pour la construction de maison à l'avenir.Son projet est d’étendre son ferme à la campagne car elle a déjà quelques bétails là-bas.
texts.en:
Phillipsonne still lives alone with her two children in the city of Antsirabe and carries out a trading activity in basic needs products. She is very happy as this is her second Kiva loan and her 15th with Vahatra.
With this loan, she intends to purchase even more basic needs products such as rice and sugar in order to bolster her stock. In fact, thanks to several consecutive loans, she has become one of the town's wholesalers. 
With the income from previous loans, Phillipsonne made her home more comfortable and purchased 2 pigs to fatten and sell to the butcher. She also bought some land for building a house in the future. Her plan is to extend her farm in the countryside as she already has some livestock there.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products (oil, eggs, rice, flour...)

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu is 52 years old with 8 children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Faleseu requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedling), wheelbarrow,  hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2006, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow,  hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Marudhambal's Group

texts.en:
Marudhambal leads a group of three women in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. Marudhambal works as a daily wage labourer, and helps support her family of three members. The women in the group, Manjula and Latha, come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. They have no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Marudhambal and family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To fund the construction of toilets at home

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a small town with her parents. She is divorced and has one child. For many years she has done business serving brides, making them more beautiful. She is willing to enlarge her business and make it more efficient. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy needed items such as wedding dresses, beauty make up, etc. for her beauty salon. 

She awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy needed items such as wedding dresses, beauty make up, etc. for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie, age 42, earns the builk of her income from operating a transportation business. She and her husband have operated their PUV (Public Utility Vehicle) and motorcycle for hire business for the past four years. For additional income, Perlie buys and sells charcoal and coconuts. She earns approximately PhP 10,000 each month through these business activities. 

She and her husband live in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, with their two children. Both children attend school. Perlie is currently serving as Barangay Treasurer in her community.

Perlie wants to earn more and has requested a loan in order to buy additional coconuts to be utilized for copra processing and re-trading. Perlie has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. 

In the future, Perlie hopes to expand her coconut trading business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to be utilized for copra processing and re-trading

loans.name: Bulere Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BULERE dont le président est Baron (il tient un carnet rose sur la photo)ont commencé à cultiver le riz depuis l'an 2000. La riziculture est pour eux une activité qui survient aux besoins familiaux d'autant plus qu'ils espèrent à partir d'elle améliorer la vie de leurs familles respectives malgré qu'ils sont fréquemment frappés par l'insuffisance de moyens ou soit par les maladies des plantes et un marché d'écoulement de leurs récoltes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called Bulere began to cultivate rice in the year 2000. The group president is Baron, who is holding a pink booklet in the photo.

Growing rice is an activity that supports the members' families; moreover, the members hope to be able to improve the lives of their families through their rice crops. Frequently, however, they are plagued by a lack of financial means, or by plant diseases, or by difficulties finding a market for their harvests.

loans.use: to cover crop maintenance, pay labor, and buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Renuga's Group

texts.en:
Renuga leads a group of three women in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. Renuga is 31, and works as a daily wage laborer. She has two young children. The women in the group come from similar backgrounds, working hard to support their families. They have no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. These families, especially their women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Taking matters into their own hands, Renuga and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of 42,000 INR to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To build a toilet at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows. He has been providing services welding the broken accessories. Recently, his welding power supply was damaged due to an electrical fluctuation, and he needs to purchase new one. He does not have enough money to buy a new power supply due to a lot of household expenses. Therefore, Sajida requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is an active field partner of Kiva, for her husband to buy a welding power supply for his work. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new welding power supply for her husband's welding work

loans.name: Jessiebel

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Jessiebel works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling firewood. Jessiebel is borrowing 7,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell to customers. Jessiebel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anyela Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una joven con 19 años de edad, trabajadora y estudiosa, dedicada a vender mercancía desde su casa, un medio que le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Su deseo es abrir nuevos locales y generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesitan.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros.
Con esto espera aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su casa, ya que esta se encuentra en muy mal estado.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 19-year-old young woman, who is hard-working and studious. She works selling merchandise from her house, a job that allows her to generate the income necessary to help her parents with the household expenses.

Her desire is to open new locations and generate employment for the people who need it most.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of perfume, cremes, cosmetics, etc. With it, she hopes to increase her sales, and therefore her income.

Her biggest dream is to remodel her house, because right now it is in very bad shape.

For this reason, she is turning to Interactuar and Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cremes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida, 49, is the mother of one son and two daughters in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He has built a very good relation with his customers. His general store is well known in town, which is the reason his business is doing well. His sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Abida requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more inventory of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Abida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her husband's general store

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer soltera con 37 años de edad, dedicada a realizar labores de campo desde muy pequeña, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.

Hoy en día cuenta con un gran cultivo de café, el cual le genera ingresos los ingresos mínimos para cubrir sus necesidades.
Requiere de un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, fertilizantes y  abonos.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando hasta mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, poder brindarle a su hija una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Como Alejandra, miles de empresarios esperan de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a single 37 year old woman who makes a living carrying out farm work and has done so since she was very young. She learned how to do this work thanks to the teachings of her parents.
 
Today she depends on a large cultivation of coffee which generates the minimum income to cover her necessities. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like insecticides, fertilizers, and manure. Her biggest dream is to continue working until the conditions of her home improve and to provide her daughter with a good economic stability and better quality of life.

Like Alejandra, thousands of entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like insecticides, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue y sus hijos, vive en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. localidad dedicada al comercio, ganado y agricultura mayormente.

La actividad que realiza Manuel es la cria y venta de ganado caprino, las compras las realiza en caserios aledaños y las ventas las realiza en Hualapampa, Manuel cuenta con 10 años dedicandose a este negocio, además cuenta con una mototaxi la cual le permite obtener ingresos adicionles. El destino del crédito serà para invertir en su negocio en compra de mayor cantidad de ganado,y alimento para los mismos. con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 48 years old. He lives in his own house made of basic materials with his wife and his children. He lives in the district of Cañaris, in Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. They have running water and electricity. The people here work mainly in commerce, raising livestock and agriculture.

Manuel's business is the raising and selling goats. He makes his purchases in neighboring villages and does his selling in Hualapampa. Manuel has been in this business for 10 years. He also has a motorcycle which allows him to obtain additional income. The loan will be invested in his business buying a greater quantity of goats and feed for them. Doing this he will generate greater income and in this way be able to improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying a greater quantity of animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Corazones Abiertos se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Porvenir 2 en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos de 14, 11 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela, su marido es taxista.
Doña Mariela hace lo posible por colaborar con los gastos del hogar y con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos que son muchos y su marido no puede solventarlos, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos por catalogo y productos de Avon y  Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, lleva más  7 años en este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para ayudar a sus hijos y su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, bisutería y varios productos más que ella vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The credit group Corazones Abiertos (Open Hearts) meets every 15 days in the El Porvenir 2 neighbourhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout all seasons of the year. It is also known as being a city without equal with many tourist attractions.
Mariela lives in this place. She is 30 years old, is in a common law relationship and has three children, ages 14, 11 and 2. The two older children go to school and her partner is a taxi driver.  
Mariela does what is possible to contribute to the expenses of the home and the expenses of her children's education, which are many and her partner cannot cover them. She works selling all kinds of clothing, shoes from a catalogue and Avon and Belcorp products (perfumes, lotions, and jewelry, among other things). She sells these things from door to door. She goes out three or four days a week offering the products, which she leaves on credit and collects payment every 8 days. She has had this business for 7 years, to provide the necessities for her children and her family.  
This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes, jewelry and various other products that she sells. She has been part of the credit group for 3 cycles and enjoys it because the loans help her a great deal. 
Her dream is that her children will have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Durga Group

texts.en:
Durga Group was started in the year 2015 at Risida village of Karlamunda block of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. These are 11 active, self-dependent women, with an objective to develop their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses.

Babita is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing fifth from the left with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 22 years old and lives with her small family, her husband and only daughter.

Babita has been engaged in vegetable cultivation and selling for the last three years. Her husband is also helping with cultivation and marketing. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. In the current market situation, the competition is also very high. Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of her business. Fund scarcity is the main concern. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for the vegetable cultivation, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc. for the vegetables and fruits business. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of her house.

The other ten members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged in different professions like a paddy business, vegetable vending, a hotel, fast food center, fishery, animal trading, etc.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for vegetable cultivation, as well as potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, apples, bananas, etc. for her vegetables and fruits business.
